resource.string: The Samnites push towards the centre. If they capture the city, all will be lost!
Bovianum is the Samnite capital. Reports indicate that Rutilus is being held here. We face a long war before we can hope to free the Consul.
Commander! The Britons force their way through on our flank!

Excellent! With matters settled at home, attention can turn to the Samnites once again. The Senate have decreed that they must not be allowed to threaten Rome again. Consul Rutilus must be recovered! Bovianum must fall!
Our blades our turned! We must retreat!

Fortunate in your ties to both Hellenic and Eastern cultures, you nonetheless face adversity: Cappadocia, now independent from Seleucid rule, is eager to establish itself in Asia. Cultural differences with the Galatians may lead to hostility, but they are fearsome warriors and might prove valuable – if unconventional – allies. Maintain close relations with Bithynia and Trapezos, and establish ties with the venerable Greek states: this way, you will be better protected against the machinations of the Seleucids and can focus on seizing control of the Pontic sea from barbarian hands. Power and riches will be yours: Pontus will reign supreme!
You can see that Capua's city limits grow to accomodate the new construction site. Now instruct the labourers to begin the workshop itself.
Your greatness impresses me! Another victory! Good!
All rebellion against Egypt and mighty Pharaoh must be righteous punished! Well done for this chastisement!
Our foes are weakened because the port is blockaded! This is a worthy thing!
An agreement worthy of Mercury himself!
Splendid! Trade with the Greeks will bring income, new types of material resources, and will encourage them to favour our cause over that of our enemies.
Carthage is ours! These people shall defy Rome no more!
My Lord, the Seleucid forces approach us! Our elephants will not stand being close to those of the enemy! Please, avoid them at all costs!

Take the time to manage your person, Silanus, and those who serve under you. The plebs will rally behind leaders of high standing. Such a figure would be useful now: I'm afraid I bring news that a crisis has arisen in Rome.
This is good! The enemy's siege gear is captured for Rome.
Worthy servant of Egypt! Your army has reached a higher level of development.
You are wise to seek knowledge in the encyclopaedia! Well done!

A defensive alliance is agreed between two factions and pledges allegiance that guarantees support should either faction be attacked. While not as far-reaching as a full military alliance, it should not be taken lightly. Should either faction come under threat, the other is obligated to mobilise their forces to assist. Refusing to support an ally breaks the agreement, significantly damages diplomatic relations between the two factions, and generally leads to global mistrust of the faction involved.

The more ambitious a character is, the more useful they are likely to be to your faction. However, it is a double-edged sword: high [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics]]ambition[[/url]] can lead to a bid for power through [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_civil_war]]civil war[[/url]], so it is important to keep an eye on such characters, they are not necessarily to be trusted.

Outflanking forces can be turned into fixing forces. If you commit a large outflanking force and do not attack from the front, the enemy will be forced to turn and face you, presenting his flanks to what was your centre.

If your party becomes too powerful, mistrust and paranoia ultimately lead to a challenge for control of your faction. At this point, [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_civil_war]]civil war[[/url]] ensues; the remaining parties unite and lead rebel forces to capture the capital and overthrow your regime. Similarly, should you be deemed too weak, you may be exiled as an enemy of the state.

By moving an army into a settlement, it becomes part of the garrison. Whilst inside, its units can replenish any losses at a faster rate and, if the settlement is attacked, will have improved morale. A garrisoned army suffers attrition when under siege if occupying a landlocked settlement or a port which is both under siege and blockade.
You do not have to order each unit individually, commander! Group the army in a structured formation if it pleases you, or assign a portion of it to a subordinate.
A closely-packed mass of troops is a superb target for missile units on the battlefield. Keep pounding them and they'll take casualties!
The Lucanian ambush has failed, their capital is threatened! We must assist them with haste!
Commander! The elephants are going into shock at the sight of the Indian breed! Pull them back immediately!
Sir, Caesar has been wounded in action and carried to his tent by his guard. The men are demoralized to hear this news!
The Gauls chose the wrong side and have paid the ultimate price. The route to the Samnite capital is clear, we shall find Rutilus soon.
Good. You have the sense to use Rome's agents to achieve your ends!
That was well done! The enemy siege weapons are yours!
Good! Athena approves of cleverness in battle, like your flanking attack!
Rebels? Rebels deserve the beating you gave them! Well done!
That was well done, if you don't mind me saying so.

Missions may be reviewed on the objectives panel. Although there is no penalty for failing, successful completion of a mission results in a reward, often in the form of bonus effects. If a mission cannot be completed due to factors outside of your control it will be cancelled.
You… you're on your own. Horsemen - with me! Double-time!
Our general Suetonius has been wounded in the melee! The men will lose heart when word gets out!
You have been cunning! Your general can now act in faction politics as well as war!
And so a mission is complete! You show wit and cunning in equal measure! Good!
Good! This new building shows Egyptian superiority over all others!
While Egypt is strong, allies are always welcome. Well done for this diplomatic triumph.
Ba'al Hammon favours you. It is good that you have had your first sea battle!

An army besieging a foreign settlement blocks trade income and traps its garrison within. Should the defenders sally out to counter-attack, the besieging army receives improved morale during the ensuing battle. Both sides suffer attrition in siege situations.
Ordering the whole army to attack throws away any chance of gaining an advantage. Even if you have enough brute force to win, you will have lost many more men than you needed to.

Repression is the enforcement of your rule by the presence of garrison troops and a useful tool for keeping populations in [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order]]order[[/url]].

This option demands that a faction becomes your satrapy or client state, taking advantage of your military might in exchange for a percentage of their income and, in the case of satrapies, unlimited military access. However, satrapies may find themselves dragged into a conflict not of their own design. Unlike a regular ally, they cannot decline a request to assist when war is declared on their overlord without automatically declaring war on their overlord themselves.
The city, Silanus! The city must be saved!
Their cavalry is charging along the riverbank! Intercept them, secure the flank!

Macedon has presumed to exert its will over the people of Athens for far too long. Decisive action must be taken against them. They have established a defensive alliance with Sparta, but their relations will crumble if the Spartans believe that Greek independence is at stake. Epirus also poses a threat to the Peloponnesus; intervention there can only strengthen your ties with Sparta. Support all true Greek states and they will surely join you in your struggle against oppression. Athens will be free!
It is clear that public order is low: the plebs will need to be appeased. Before they can be offered the carrot, however, they must be shown the stick. Destroy the rebel army!
Our agent carried out the task! Well done!
A rival dies at an assassin's hand. I am sure you had absolutely NOTHING to do with it. Well done.
Wonderful! Sometimes crushing an enemy is the best solution!
Truly, you are a credit to your father and his before him!
The smell of the enemy's beasts was too much for our elephants! They have lost their heads and are running amok in confusion!
The recruits will begin their training immediately, Tribune.
Rome's glory is well served by your work in creating this building!
This is very good. Your agent was successful!
Give thanks to Neptune, but take due credit for your victory!
Good! The enemy ship is sunk, and the waves look much more wholesome now!
You have done well! This fine building shows your worth!
Like a knife in the dark, our agent did the job! Well done!
Your cunning has been matchless. Your general can now take part in faction politics!
The port has been taken by your command! You have served Carthage well!
There! You see what your men can do with proper leadership?

The equipment chain improves arms and armour production. Whilst the basic workshop unlocks new unit types, those buildings further down the chain offer improved armour, weapons and siege equipment for your armies.
There are many ways to achieve victory at sea. Overwhelm the enemy with missiles, board and engage their crews hand-to-hand, or ram their vessels to sink them!
The enemy cower in the town, inviting an attack. We will have to flush them out.

As your campaign progresses, growth enables surplus population to accumulate in your settlements, enabling them to [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]expand[[/url]]. Certain buildings will improve that rate of [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_provinces_growth]]growth[[/url]].
Commander, you have done it! Antiochus and his army have been destroyed. There can be no doubt as to who is the true successor to Alexander the Great!
The Samnites have won the day! Come, Silanus, we must flee! Every man, regroup at Rome!
The Gauls seek to make gains from us by allying with the Samnites? Their treachery will be their downfall, I will see it done!

After grouping units you have the opportunity to hand that group over to AI control. In this case they are given a set of basic instructions, such as attacking a certain unit or defending a specific position. If an AI-controlled group destroys its target it will defend its current position until given further orders.
Well done, you’ve used one of your agents.
Congratulations, your army has reached another level of development.
Good! You have won using beasts rather than men alone!
Suppressing a rebellion is always cruel, but you had the strength to do it. Well done!
Good! Rebels deserve nothing but harsh punishment! Well done!
You have the cunning of Melqart! To win using beasts! Excellent!

City centre buildings may be constructed in provincial capitals, and provide facilities and entertainment for the populace. Depending on your chosen faction, they can be developed in various ways, from trade and education, to slave markets and amphitheatres. Most city centre buildings improve public order and increase your cultural grip, agricultural output, and income.

In addition to attributes, many units and ships have their own special abilities, that affect a variety of factors such as their morale or the damage they inflict. Many, such as the “Frenzied Charge”, improve the unit’s attack ability for a limited time. Special abilities are unlocked by researching military technologies in the campaign game. Many special abilities cannot be used again for a “cooldown” period, so it is important to use them sparingly and only at crucial moments.
Attack, men, your consul watches over you! Strike down the Samnite invaders! Show them no mercy!
Be advised! The Samnites raise more armies against us!
Our Eagles! We are lost...
The Samnites press further into Capua, they threaten the centre!
Well done! Your army is well developed. Rome needs strong armies!
This sea victory is yours! But give prudent thanks to Poseidon!
Ah, well done! Assassination is the tool of all great statesmen.
Good work! Our people thank you for this new building!
Congratulations! You have taken the enemy siege equipment, a wise tactic!

A military alliance is the strongest bond that can be made between two factions. Both parties swear allegiance to each other, guaranteeing military assistance should either start a war or be attacked themselves. Although it can only be formally ended by mutual agreement, failing to obey the terms of an active alliance not only breaks the agreement, but results in a severe diplomatic relations penalty.
The population of this province is growing, Proconsul. Cities must expand and develop if they are to prosper. Well-managed urban centres are the engines of civilization.
Terrain has an effect on a unit's movement speed. Sticking to roads or short grass will ensure your units move at maximum speed.
Draw swords, men! We must secure these hills for Rome!
Our enemies make gains against us, Silanus! The Senate are anxious that you regain the initiative.
The enemy have won the day, Silanus! We must fall back and regroup!
Neatly done! Your first victory! Ares would salute you!
There is nothing wrong with murder, as long as the right rival is murdered! Well done!
You show a great lack of foolishness! It is wise to use agents!
Carthage thanks you! Your army has reached a higher level of development.
An agreement worthy of Ba'al's wisdom!

Some units are able to adopt different formations that enhance their combat skills on the battlefield. For instance, wedge formation, originally devised by the Scythians and later known as the boar’s head, helps a cavalry charge break through enemy lines by reducing the surface area presented to the enemy at the point of impact, which also limits the damage caused by missiles fired or thrown in defence against it. The flying wedge is a variant of the same formation particular to Roman cavalry, with the same triangular shape hollowed out like an arrow head.
When the enemy have a lot of fast, light troops or cavalry, consider moving your light infantry and skirmishers closer to other supporting units, so they don't get caught in the open.
The siege weapons on the walls can repel them. See to it!
Silanus has fallen! A black day indeed! Men, retreat!

The people of Epirus are fools. Having utterly failed to conquer Rome, they crawl back and presume to conquer Greece. To try is not to win. They will know this when you meet them in battle. Macedon may join you, but they are no better in the end: Alexander’s conquests have left them with delusions of grandeur. They will be checked, as will every other aggressor. You may fare better working with Athens and other true Greek states, but history has often taught otherwise. Ultimately, trust only in Sparta, and you will prevail.
Silanus! Our men start to rout!
Excellent, you have managed your economy well so your treasury is in profit.
Moving troops away from the frontline is problematic: it will leave Salernum wide open to attack. Another army must be raised. A new commander must be appointed.
Thank the gods! Rome's honour is saved! You recaptured the eagle!
Good work. Our cause will be well served by this new agent.

An [[url:/manual/single-player/0022_enc_page_campaign_play_military_ambush]]ambush[[/url]] is a sneak attack on a passing army. The usual rules for deployment do not apply here: your forces will attack the enemy whilst they are in marching order. This is not always the best option to take in every situation. The enemy army will not be able to move until the battle begins, so deploy carefully to cause maximum confusion and disorder.
Varus! Accursed coward! Push forward while he distracts the enemy!

Our primary goal is the defence of Rome. When we have secured our own borders we can look to assist our allies. Our barracks are repaired, and the stablemaster sends us horsemen to aid the war effort. Let us recruit more and strengthen further.
Queen Boudicca has fallen! Now we shall see how the chicken fares without its head!

War co-ordination goes further than alliances and requests to join wars, it enables factions to mark specific targets, such as a particular settlement or agent. Place a marker on the campaign map to label something a war co-ordination target.
Well done, you’ve advanced one of your generals to the point where he can take part in your faction’s politics.
Good work! Our people thank you for this new building!
A wise act. Your army needed a new unit.
Excellent! Gold sticks to your hands, for the treasury shows a fine profit!
You have earned this sea victory! Ba'al's blessing on you!
You have grasped the importance of sneakiness, I see. Good!

When a group of units is formed, you can give control to an AI commander and assign it the task of attacking the enemy or defending a position on the battlefield. The AI will then choose objectives for its group, react to nearby threats, and maintain control until the battle is over or the player takes back control. With a group selected, use the attack or defend button to select the AI’s stance, then left-click to select an enemy target or an area to defend.
This town belongs to Rome!
Macedonian forces sighted, commander. We must engage them at once!
Ptolemy has been wounded and carried to his tent! His absense will be noticed by the men, commander!
Excellent, your agent was successful in their action.
I give thanks to Jupiter and Mercury! The mission was a success!
You have desert cunning, my lord! Your general is now able to take on a political role.
By Jupiter! That was neatly done!

Upgrading the port chain enables a province or region capital to specialise in one of the following areas: fishing, trade or navy. You can increase fishing output, sea trade routes and the number of available ship types at a provincial capital. Whilst these options can also be explored in minor settlements, there are fewer upgrades available.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_offices]]Cursus Honorum[[/url]] are the offices and commissions that can be allocated to [[url:/manual/single-player/0047a_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_generals_admirals]]generals[[/url]] in your faction when they reach a certain age or rank. There is a power cost associated with the Cursus Honorum, meaning they can be used to placate useful but potentially [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_civil_war]]dangerous[[/url]] individuals.

You have selected a target outside the highlighted area. This means your character cannot reach its target this turn. Provided that an enemy does not block their path they will continue the journey during the next turn.
The Romans in the village need our help and we ignore them! What is your bidding Silanus?
Equites advancing on our right flank! Numidians, charge!
Excellent, you have ambushed an enemy army.
Good work! Ares celebrates your latest victory!
Excellent. A new agent. While sneaking about is womanly, it is also useful.
Truly, Egypt has been well served by this agent. Well done.
A new building! Good! This is most welcome to the people of Carthage.
Carthage admires prudence, and you show it in abundance! The treasury is in profit!

To select more than one unit, hold down the control key whilst left-clicking on each unit or unit card. Alternatively, you can hold down the left mouse button and drag a box around them. Groups make it far easier to issue move or attack orders to multiple units. Use the Create Selection Group button or the G key to create up to ten groups, using their respective number keys or the tabs on the review panel to select them.
The city is ours!
The Consul and his men will be overpowered, we must come to their aid!
The Lucanians are defeated! Our allies have fallen, and their people enslaved!
Their horsemen are broken! Close in on their flanks - surround them!

An army's [[url:/manual/single-player/0018_enc_page_campaign_play_military_stances]]stance[[/url]] represents how its capabilities change under a number of situations, including [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruitment[[/url]], marching, laying [[url:/manual/single-player/0021_enc_page_campaign_play_military_sieges]]siege[[/url]] or ambush, and making camp. Each one costs a number of action points to execute and once entered, the army will stay in that stance until given a different order. It is not possible for an army to enter a stance when on a transport ship at sea.
Congratulations, you’ve constructed your first building!
Well done, you’ve forced another faction into becoming your vassal.
The treasury grows, and the credit must go to you. This is a worthy thing.
And so you demonstrate further wisdom: an objective achieved! Well done!
Cunning is welcome in a commander! Your general can now play a part in Carthage's politics.
An agreement worthy of Osiris! Most excellent!
Excellent! You have the look of eagles, if I may be so bold!
Capua is in sight. Report!

Remember that the goal here is to capture the [[url:/manual/single-player/0084_enc_page_battle_play_phase_conflict_sieges]]settlement[[/url]], not destroy it! To achieve victory either kill or rout the entire army, or capture the central plaza. Before you begin, ensure that any siege weapons are positioned close enough to target the enemy defences.
Antiochus has managed to defeat us! Egypt will surely fall!

Congratulations are in order, Propraetor Silanus, for I understand that the Senate have appointed you to lead the invasion of Samnium. An easy choice to make, if I may say. The Senate wish for you to return the settlement of Salernum to us. It was overrun by the Samnites some years ago and its capture would again give Rome control of Campania.

Your time has come. Recent setbacks in Magna Graecia compelled you to establish power on the Greek mainland. The Spartans think themselves superior to all others: they will know otherwise once you lay waste to their lands. The Athenians have become weak and would rather prattle than fight wars. They will fall in time, but may be of use against their Macedonian masters: the scions of Alexander still fancy themselves worthy of his empire and must be stopped. Perhaps, then, a mass invasion of the Italian peninsula: you have unfinished business with Rome and Syracuse. The enemies of Epirus will be subdued!
Congratulations, you’ve wiped a rival faction from the map!
Good work! Rome has need of new units in her armies.
Good. Learning is a Roman road to power.
Good work! The army has reached a better state of development!
This is good. You have done well to recruit a new unit to our cause.
You have a new unit in the army. This is good.
Well done! Your first victory! I pray to the Ba'al Hammon for many more!

When a faction agrees to become a satrapy or client state to another, it effectively agrees to serve as a subordinate. This means paying regular tribute to new overlords, and in the case of satrapies, breaking all alliances, non-aggression pacts, and military access pacts with other factions. Should an overlord come under attack, its subordinate is obligated either to assist in their defence or break their agreement, and, in the case of satrapies, declare war against them. If an overlord decides not to help a subordinate when a third party declares war on them, the agreement is broken. Whilst client states retain their diplomatic freedoms, a satrapy cannot instigate diplomacy apart from trade agreements with other factions.

On the battlefield you can use the W, A, S and D keys to move the camera and left-click on units or their unit cards to select them. Move a selected unit by right-clicking on a location. Right-clicking on an enemy unit issues an attack order, whereas double-clicking will cause your unit to run or charge. To get an overview of the entire battlefield use the tab key or press the Tactical Map button.

The general has a huge influence on his army’s fortunes in battle, not least because the abilities at his disposal can turn the tide in their favour. Each faction can unlock generals’ abilities and develop them in-line with skills and experience, sometimes upgrading them to become stronger or affect more units. There are two main types: powerful lingering abilities like “The Fear”, which can be used only a handful of times due to its longer cooldown time, and short impact boosts like “War Cry” that pass quickly but can be used many times.
Get off your mounts, men! You cannot hold an area on horseback!

Your faction could be making more money through [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance]]trade[[/url]]. Use [[url:/manual/single-player/0038_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/url]] to make new trade agreements.
Silanus! The will of our allies is breaking: they begin to flee!

Fetch your swords! The Samnites dare to challenge us again. It will be five seasons before they reach Roman territory, but we have little defence in place. We must move to protect Capua while we still have time.

The Samnites will be fortifying the mountain passes inland from Salernum, but Buxentum to the south is relatively undefended. Some Lucanian exiles are offering a substantial reward if we retake the city for Rome. To achieve surprise, however, we should invade by sea.
You have been most astute! Your general is now able to take on a political role…
An enemy ship righteously sunk! Splendid!
Ba'al Hammon loves honourable men, and must prize you! The army standard is retaken!
By Ba'al Hammon's sacred fires, you show your worth!

When a settlement reaches the top of its building chain and a particular event has occurred it may then be possible to construct a [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction# enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_construction_legendary]]legendary[[/url]] building. Once built it cannot be destroyed under any circumstances. If your faction is the first to construct one it will be awarded a permanent faction [[url:/manual/single-player/0041_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_traits_faction]]trait[[/url]] and its associated effects.
Any units or ships that rout following a general's death will automatically become shattered.
Very well. Send word to Rome that our attack will begin immediately!
Salernum has fallen Silanus! Capua is threatened once more! The Senate demand that you take immediate action to safeguard the home front!

Farms, markets and ports supply food and settlements and certain [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]buildings[[/url]] within them consume it. Although food is automatically distributed across your territory, if total consumption is not matched by production then food shortages can occur, which can lead to unrest and, ultimately, [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellion[[/url]]. Make sure you keep food production buildings upgraded.
Rally, men! We're nearly clear of the forest!
Crassus blocks our route out of the valley. We must defeat him before Pompey arrives!
The Britons flee, victory is ours! Let this be a lesson to all who would oppose the empire!
Well done, you’ve assassinated a rival character.
While overtaxation brings its own problems, it is equally important to keep a positive balance sheet. This war cannot be won without money coming in.
Excellent! Rebellion should be crushed. It is not the Roman way.
The mission is done. Well done. Our people's interests are advanced.
Our rivals shrink in number! Excellent! You have wiped this faction from the face of the land!
You are blessed once more with victory! Excellent! I give thanks to Ba'al!

The scale of any victory in battle is measured by the number of casualties suffered by each side. However, in siege, port siege and encampment battles the attacker can capture key positions known as victory points. When two thirds of the available victory points have been captured, or the only one in the case of minor settlements or encampment battles, the defenders’ victory tickets will start to diminish. The defender must reclaim their victory points to stop this happening or lose the battle when the number of tickets reaches zero.

In a tribal society or a monarchy, your tribe or family branch could be challenged should they be deemed weak, leading to civil war. Such conflicts can only continue for a limited time, at which point they are automatically resolved by treaty, the terms of which are decided by the balance of power at the point of resolution.
The larger your settlements, the more food is consumed, so it is important to keep food producing buildings upgraded in tandem with the size of your settlement in order to avoid shortages.
Bovianum is there for the taking! Let us attack!
If a faction's initial offer or demand isn’t quite what you had in mind you can use the counter-offer option to enable further negotiation to take place, rather than simply rejecting it.
Your general is now able to take on a political role… You have been cunning to arrange this!
The gods drink to celebrate! You have destroyed this faction! Excellent!
This is very good. You have researched a new technology.
A rival fallen to your assassin! This is cunning worthy of the gods!
Our enemy draws near! Look alive, soldiers! We go to battle!

If simply left, damaged buildings will be automatically [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_construction_repair]]repaired[[/url]] very slowly over time at no cost. However, if a building is ruined you must select it and click on the repair button.

There are many new [[url:/manual/single-player/0039_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_technology]]technologies[[/url]] to be researched that will assist your faction in its bid for [[url:/manual/single-player/0013_enc_page_campaign_play_objectives]]supremacy[[/url]]. To select one, open the technology panel via the dedicated button.
Extremes of heat or cold will give a fatigue penalty to units not used to living and fighting in such conditions. Troops from those parts of the world are naturally resistant to this penalty.
We're under attack! Look to the eagles! Defend them! Hold on!
Tribune, word has reached us that Leanas has fallen and the defenders are withdrawing! The onagers struck the decisive blow! Capua is being overrun!
Ptolemy’s position is too strong. Our army is lost.

Rome's treasury has been drained dry by this war. Taxes have been raised and the people neglected. There has been unrest, and matters have come to a head. A revolt is underway, it must be quelled by a show of force!
Ares would approve! You have used an ability. Good.
Ah, the enemy weep! You have captured their siege weapons! Well done!
Ba'al Hammon rewards you with a new skill for your worthy agent!
The enemy send troops to capture the camp, Silanus! Stop them!
Have the troops stop and set up camp. Break out the rations. When we renew our attack the Samnite end shall surely come.
Excellent, you’ve destroyed an enemy ship!
Congratulations, you’ve captured the enemy’s siege equipment.
An enemy region taken! Remarkable! Good work! Soon, perhaps, the province…
You show a strong will! The port is now blockaded! Good!
The enemy suffer at your mighty hands! The port is captured.
You have served Egypt most handsomely by capturing the enemy siege weapons.
Good! Remember: get to your enemies before they get you!

An army ordered to carry out a forced march gets a significant increase in the action points available to it, but is unable to initiate a battle. Furthermore, a marching army has a reduced line of sight, reflecting its focus on the job in hand; the drawback being that it is more susceptible to ambushes. If attacked, all units in a marching army suffer reduced morale to reflect the inherent surprise element.
Time is against us, Commander. This campaign has gone on for long enough, the men must rest.

An army transported by ship can launch an attack against an enemy port. Once the attack order has been given and the fleet has sailed to the coastline, your army will disembark and attack. It is not possible to withdraw from battle once this has occurred. Friendly armies aboard nearby ships cannot act as reinforcements. Only armies that have disembarked and are not already engaged in a coastal assault can reinforce them.
Commander, we have men in the enemy docks!

Your possessions are divided: you must secure additional territory to ensure their protection and to establish your faction as the supreme Mediterranean power. You are already at war with the Turdetani – capturing their settlement of Kartuba will further consolidate your position in Iberia. Relations are strained with Rome and Syracuse: you may find an ally in the Etruscan League should you choose to invade the Italian peninsula, and maintaining good relations with the Masaesyli and your African protectorates will prove vital should you need to repel an invasion. Carthage will prevail!
Well done! You used beasts, not just men, to defeat the foe!
Nicely done! That flanking attack was the right move!
By Zeus and Hera! That was neatly done!

Siege artillery units such as onagers can be recruited in the same manner as other units. However, siege engines are constructed on-site and deployed when assaulting enemy settlements. Ranging from simple battering rams to hulking siege towers, they directly connect with enemy walls, but are heavy, slow moving and vulnerable to attack. As such, it’s advisable to escort them lest the enemy sally out to meet their besiegers.
The enemy has launched a coastal assault against you. If you accept your force will move to engage the attackers. Refusal to take part in the battle will cause them to retreat.
This is it, draw swords men! Charge!

We cannot wait for reinforcements, men, we must act! You have all trained for this day - now there is an enemy before us and glory to be won! I may not be a general but the gods honour me by allowing me to lead you on this day! Now, advance!
Congratulations, you have captured an enemy port!
Well done. The port is blockaded, and no ships move!
Rome honours you! Another region added to the empire! Soon the province will be ours!
By the gods of sea and wave, that was well done! The ship needed sinking.
Good! You have used an ability! A wise man neglects nothing in his quest for victory.

Chariots are the tanks of antiquity. Usually comprising of a driver, with at least one passenger armed with bow or javelin, they are best used to either disrupt the enemy’s front ranks prior to an infantry charge or as a skirmishing force. Ideally, chariots require space and flat terrain to ensure they can attack and swiftly withdraw to regroup. They should always avoid melee entanglements and any contact with heavy cavalry.
Proconsul, you should consider recruiting a Champion to act on your behalf. Such a man will inspire the army to even greater feats of heroism.
The records tab is used to log events and store campaign statistics in one place for ease of reference.
Keep moving! We must get through! Where is Arminius? Someone find Arminius! We need his auxiliaries!
Let us scout the Samnite advance with the help of our maps.

Your former vassals, Cyrenaica, have deigned to declare their independence and must be brought to heel. Cyprus remains true, but is at risk from invasion, as are your eastern possessions. The Seleucid Empire is a particular threat, a sprawling Successor Kingdom desperate to maintain power by whatever means possible; an alliance with Nabatea may help to keep them in check. Maintain trade relations with the Greek states and beware of Macedonian treachery, as they too may seek to gain control of Alexander’s former empire. Egypt shall be victorious!
This option is a formal request to end hostilities between your faction and another.
That’s superb play, you’ve won your first battle.
Well done, you’ve recaptured your army’s eagle.
Excellent! The port is taken! I give thanks to Neptune for your achievement!
Count yourself among the sons of Ares, now that you have fought a battle! Well done!
Your worth is greater than gold! Another victory! Most excellent!
A new trait for this general of Carthage! Your efforts have been noted by Ba'al!
Good! You flanked them in fine style!

Ambush stance immobilises an army but increases its line of sight and makes it invisible to nearby enemy forces. If undetected, a hidden army can attack any enemy that wanders into its zone of control. The success of such an ambush depends on the quality of the commanders involved and the nature of the surrounding terrain.

Assault ships are the frontline of your fleet. Large vessels with strong hulls and fearsome rams, they carry the fight to the enemy, ramming their hulls whilst missile infantry in towers pepper the decks below. Finally, the boarding party leap aboard to finish off any survivors hand-to-hand.
When attacking an enemy that is deployed on a hill, attack up the most gentle slope, even if it takes a while to get there. Fewer troops will be exhausted by the time they reach the top of the slope.
The enemy must be routed! Target their flanks or attack them from behind!
Rome is well protected from attack by a line of hills running inland. Any Samnite assault must come from the south, through Capua.

Their light troops will not outrun a horse, no matter how little armour they bear! The barracks in Capua will permit the recruitment of cavalrymen but it remains damaged from the recent siege. By repairing it and recruiting cavalry we will give ourselves a powerful advantage.
The Gauls are beaten! This day they learn the true might of Rome!
Fight well, men, and hold your ground! The fate of Rutilus and all of Rome itself depends on us!
Let the runners go, men, they will carry news of their defeat back to their people! Today belongs to Rome!
A worthy feat of arms! The port is now blockaded. Well done!
That was a splendid charge, and now Carthage's enemies run! Excellent!
My lord, you are a lion of the desert!
The city is falling! Soon it will belong to Rome!
Offering a gift of money to another faction improves relations between you. State gifts can be refused, but with a diplomatic relations penalty for doing so.
Your agent has a new trait! This is good news!
Good work. You are a true son of Ares!

Trade between regions and other factions is vital to economic development and prosperity. A province automatically receives trade wealth based on its constituent buildings. Some regions are rich in resources and valuable trade goods with prices that vary depending on supply and demand at any given time. Factions trade both goods and resources, so trade agreements made through diplomacy enable profitable trade routes to other factions.
Silanus, formal contact has been established with the Greeks who inhabit our Southern shores. If treated with care, they may become useful allies in our struggle against the Samnites.
A counterattack! Close ranks men!
Pompey has been defeated! The dictatorship of Rome awaits! Hail Caesar!
Pharnaces has fallen! Surely his army will not resist for long!

The Samnites seem to have stripped Buxentum clean - very little is left of her famed wealth. No doubt it will have been taken to their capital. Nevertheless our tax income will grow as the territory held by Rome increases. Be sure to put it to good use!
Well done, you have fought your first sea battle.
Poseidon loves a winner, such as you! Congratulations on capturing a ship!
Your commands have been wise and well rewarded! The port is captured.
A first victory! Excellent! I pray to the gods for more of the same!
The port has been captured. Let us celebrate the enemy's discomfort!
The Senate extend their congratulations for your victory, Silanus. It only remains for you to decide what to do with the settlement. Looting will upset the townsfolk, but will swell Rome's treasury.

The [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance#enc_text_manual_hud_finances]]taxes[[/url]] tab shows a summary of your projected tax income, maps the effect that tax has on public order, and allows the adjustment of taxation levels across your empire. Click on the zoom to location button to go straight to the [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]] with the lowest [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order]]public order[[/url]]. In most cases, adjusting tax levels should fix the problem.
The Samnite infantry is strong, but their men are no match for Roman soldiers!
Our general is wounded and has retreated to the siege camp! Word has spread amongst the men, they lose heart!
Shields together men, and hold the line!
Battle is upon us, commander, but do not grow weary. You need not oversee every skirmish in person.

Your people are warriors, but you seek to live in harmony with your kin. The Demetae have chosen to disrupt your peace and bring harm to your people, so stopping them must be your first order of business. The Brigantes are also unreliable and should be dealt with by any means possible. Finally, the Belgic Atrebates leave you little choice but war, after their many attempts to settle your lands. However, you share no bad blood with the Dumnonii, so they may prove valuable allies when you cross the narrow sea. By the will of Andraste, the Iceni will never yield!

A confederation allows factions to join together for the common good, combining military resources to make all members stronger. Upon formation, your target faction ceases to act independently and their strongest armies and fleets become confederation property. Anyone already at war with the target faction may choose to declare war on every faction within it.
Well done! A wise Roman general always uses his troops' abilities, not just their swords!
Good! Your general lives to fight another day for you!
You have done well, to capture the enemy's siege weapons like that!
You have won a great victory! Well done, but be thankful to the gods of wind and wave!
So, then, you captured a ship. The blessings of the Lady upon you.

Slaves are a vital part of your labour force, enabling you to significantly boost your economy. Dealing with slaves is a double-edged sword, however, as enslaving enemy prisoners following battles or capture of their settlements can damage diplomatic relations with other factions of a similar culture. Slaves are automatically distributed across your empire. If their numbers grow too large there may be dissent amongst them, eventually leading to slave revolts if left unchecked. Revolts can also be incited by enemy champions, so it is vital to recruit dignitaries to counteract subterfuge in your territory.
Do not rush hastily into an attack, Commander. There exists the option to starve the enemy out.
Engineers to the fore! We need siege equipment to breach those walls! See to it, on the double!

The barbarians are coming! Tylis in particular is a problem, and must be kept in check. The Athenians continue to resent your rule. They may turn against you or convince your Spartan allies to betray their treaty. No matter, faced with hostility from Epirus, Sparta should remain true and may distract Epirus long enough for you to consolidate your rule at home. Conflict with the remaining Successor Kingdoms is inevitable and you must be ready, do not be afraid to seek military support from others if necessary. Rest assured: Macedon is the true heir to Alexander’s legacy; it will rise once more!
Well done, you’ve used the in-game encyclopaedia to learn about the game.
You have fought your first sea battle. Good work! The tritons will be impressed!
You show cunning! To win a battle using beasts! That is good.
Excellent! Your first sea battle! Amun Ra shines on you!

Obedience to the rule of your faction is measured in [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order]]public order[[/url]]. If unhappiness outweighs happiness and is left unchecked for a long time, it can lead to [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellion[[/url]]. Keep taxes at reasonable levels, maintain sufficient food levels and garrison armies in [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]settlements[[/url]] if necessary to stop low public order bubbling over into insurrection.
Use small mobile forces as bait for ambushes. Leave them looking vulnerable in plain view, with your main ambushing force hidden nearby.
That's the last of them! No more guarding grain stores, we are meant for this!
Good! Your first victory! Further glories await!
Well done! You have fought your first sea battle. May gods of wave and wind serve you well!
Our people's honour is restored! My thanks! You have recaptured the army standard!

With wide, heavy hulls to support firing platforms, artillery ships carry ballistae and onagers in order to pummel enemy fleets. In battle, they provide support for assault and missile ships, and are kept back to soften the enemy with a range of projectiles.
The enemy raid our commerce routes, Commander, pillaging and sinking our trade ships! Put a fleet out to sea and stop them!

Every faction has a set of characteristics particular to them, known as faction traits. They work in a similar way to character traits, each one having one or more effects that bestow a bonus or penalty. Faction traits are permanent. Check the faction summary tab for more details.
Prepare javelins!

The Celts think themselves superior, but their decadence makes them weak. The Boii are nearby: put them out of their misery and seize their lands for the tribe! Move westward and you will get the chance to kill Gauls, although other German tribes stand between you. War comes naturally to your people, and the tribes are ever at one another’s throats, but waging war will make your rivals more open to negotiation. However, your ultimate goal should be confederation: the joining of tribes to make a single stronger one. Under Suebi leadership, the people of Germania will rise up and crush their enemies!
Good! Good! The enemy have lost their siege gear! Good work!
The gods will be pleased! The enemy have lost their siege equipment.
You are a worthy servant of Egypt, to gain such a victory at sea!
You are a worthy son of Egypt! To take the enemy siege equipment like that! Excellent!

When ordered into a raiding stance, your army draws income from trade routes and nearby settlements. This decreases its upkeep costs, but reduces its defensive capabilities and movement range on the campaign map. When raid is selected, the routes and settlements that can be raided within a given radius are highlighted. The amount of booty gained is relative to the size of your army and is deducted from the income of the route or settlement in question. Marauding across foreign territory harms diplomatic relations, but isn’t an overt act of war. In dire situations, an army may raid within its own territory, causing a degree of public unrest as a result.
Orders must be communicated quickly on the battlefield, commander, and there are means of allowing this. You must master signalling to truly prosper as a general!
Press the Ctrl + S keys simultaneously to quickly save the game from the campaign map. Press Ctrl + L to quickly load the last save. This does not work when playing on Legendary Difficulty.

The [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance]]trade[[/url]] tab details all resources produced across your territory and shows whether they are exported to your trade partners. Also shown are the resources gained from trade partners or those you are yet to acquire. Certain advanced units and [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]buildings[[/url]] require access to these resources before they can be [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruited[[/url]] or constructed.
Capua has yet to recover from the siege. The settlement cannot withstand another attack.
The Pontic army is put to flight! Rome is victorious!

Your old rivals, the Aedui, are forever seeking to thwart you: if they will not join your cause then you must march upon Bibracte and take it by storm. You may find support from your Pictones allies, but remember that your enemies also have support. Seek the allegiance of other Gallic tribes and crush all who oppose you: Gaul must be unified! Trade with the Greeks of Massilia will bring you wine and wealth, but maintaining contact with Mediterranean powermongers will inevitably lead to conflict. By Toutatis, they will feel the might of a united Gaul! So speak the Arverni!
Neptune bless you! You have taken an enemy ship!
The enemy have lost their siege equipment! Well done! It will cost them dear!
Nicely done! Your efforts are paying off handsomely.
Good work. You should offer sacrifice to Zeus in thanks!

War can be declared by attacking another faction’s possessions or formally via the diplomatic option. However, such a move can have major repercussions on the political landscape beyond the two factions involved. All treaties between the two are broken and, if military or defensive alliances are in place, other factions will also be brought into the war. Peace is achieved only when one of the warring factions is wiped out or if a peace treaty is agreed through diplomacy.
The best way to avoid being flanked is to stop the enemy flanking force from arriving. Cavalry are useful for this, so always deploy them on your flanks.

Onagers and other siege weapons can be a great incentive for a defending enemy on hilly terrain not to just sit there and wait for you. You can bombard them until they move to a more suitable place to die.
Repairs on the barracks are underway. Put the labourers of Capua to another task. A workshop near the frontline would be useful. This would supply and maintain better-quality armour for our men.
The Romans advance, all pomp and spectacle! Let us show them how a real army fights. Smash them into the river!
This attack has failed! Fall back men, we must regroup!
The Lucanians have set an ambush. Let us hope that it succeeds.
Well done! That ship needed sinking, Neptune will be pleased that you show courage!
That was neatly done! The enemy siege weapons are taken!
Excellent! I drink to your continued success after this first victory!

Working alongside the heavier assault ships, missile ships are nimble craft with narrow decks that rely on their manoeuvrability and ranged attacks to defeat the enemy. Often deployed as skirmishers in the opening stages of a sea battle, missile ships should be kept active for the duration, avoiding close engagements and supporting the ramming and boarding of the assault ships.

Troops can be stationed inside a settlement to defend it in the event of [[url:/manual/single-player/0021_enc_page_campaign_play_military_sieges]]attack[[/url]]. Whilst there they will also act as a deterrent to any [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellious[[/url]] tendencies amongst the population.
Your orders, General?
The slingers in the village are in our debt. They pledge their allegiance and have joined our ranks.
I see a shallow ford across the river which will give us passage into the city. Forwards!
Propraetor, your very presence can sway this battle! Your word can rally and inspire the men before you. Use your influence!

We have concealed matters of state from you until now, but you will appreciate that military successes can only be built on civil foundations. The wheels of war are turned by money. A sound economy and thriving populace will fuel our ambitions of conquest.
Congratulations on winning another battle!
You are a true warrior of honour! The standard is recaptured!
All Egypt will undoubtedly celebrate your first victory! Well done!
Good! This agent has a new trait! He will continue to serve Carthage well!

When they join you in a war, missions can be offered to all your allies, vassals, satrapies, etc. - although there is a chance they may not be accepted. Over time, you may receive similar diplomatic missions from your allies in return.
We must continue to recruit men into the army. The enemy come by road: they approach with speed.

The time has come to establish a new and great empire in the east. War with Parthava is inevitable if you are to consolidate your position. However, patience is advised: they have no love for their Seleucid masters and allowing them to rebel first will ensure that they receive no military support from their overlords when you strike. Taming the northern tribes may buy you the time you need. Alliances with other satrapies are a possibility, although you should be wary of limiting your expansion options. The decision is yours. All hail the new Parthian Empire!
Ares himself would have been pleased by that charge! The enemy run! Well done!
You show wisdom in looking for wisdom! Well done for using the encyclopaedia.
Good! Another victory to add to your tally! You have greatness in you!
Ah, you are a cunning one! That flanking attack was well done!
The fires were kind when they gave you wisdom, lord!

Armies and fleets can be assigned stances which improve their movement rate, line of sight, and various attack and defence attributes. Select an army and click on the Stances button at the bottom of the screen to choose one. Crossing water with armies and agents is achieved simply by right-clicking on your desired destination, they will automatically board a transport ship and begin their passage, disembarking once they hit land.

All units and ships have attributes that govern their capabilities in battle, whether they are always active or are triggered in battle under certain conditions. For example, some units are inherently fearsome, so their very presence in battle can “Frighten” an enemy, reducing their morale. Similarly, some units “Can Hide in woods”, enabling them to remain out of sight of enemy units within certain distances.
The Senate requests that you negotiate a trade agreement with our new Greek friends.
When attacking an enemy that refuses to move, sit back and shoot at them if you can. Even if they have missile superiority it may be worth the cost.

The [[url:/manual/single-player/0092n_enc_page_battle_play_interface_withdraw]]withdraw[[/url]] button causes a unit or ship to leave the battle by travelling toward the edge of the field by the shortest route. It can be called back at any stage before it leaves by issuing a move or attack order.
During the deployment phase you can secretly arrange your units inside the deployment zone before battle commences. When you are ready to fight click on the scroll button.
You’ve supressed a rebellion, well done!
Your first sea battle! Excellent! I give praise to Neptune!
Well done! The port is now yours! A feat of arms to celebrate!
Excellent! There is wisdom in using agents to defeat your rivals.
You have done well. The army has reached another level of development.
The sea is ours!
Our army has been broken, Pompey will be dictator for life! We have failed!
The Samnites are confined to their mountains and deprived of their main route to the sea. We shall visit them soon.
Victory! My soldiers, you are the toast of Rome!

A defensive alliance is an obligation to support another faction only if it suffers an official declaration of war. If a member is attacked its allies will be asked to join the war against the aggressor. Such an agreement can be upgraded to full military alliance, vassalage or client status.
That’s superb play, you’ve won a sea battle.
You are a true son of Ares! The standard is recaptured! Excellent!
I give thanks to the gods of the sea! You show your worth by this victory!
The fish will feed on the drowned! Well done for sinking that ship!
Congratulations! Egypt will celebrate the news that you retook the army standard!
Superb! Athena enjoys cunning flanking attacks like that!

By setting camp, your army fortifies itself against attack and defends the surrounding area. Although immobile, a fortified army has greater defensive capabilities, line of sight and reinforcement range. If attacked, it can also deploy fixed defences such as barricades, wooden stakes, spike traps, and, if playing Rome, a temporary fort on the battlefield.
The Samnites move on Capua!
The Romans press the centre hard. Hold fast, men. Push them back!
Their forces are breaking. Cavalry, cut them down!

The bonuses awarded from dilemma decisions, events, mission rewards and faction traits are displayed here. These may take the form of bonuses to income, construction or recruitment costs, boosts to unit experience, etc. Some are permanent - as in the case of faction traits - others are temporary, lasting just a few turns.

When [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_happiness]]unhappiness[[/url]] becomes too great the people will riot, slaves will revolt or a full-blown [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellion[[/url]] will occur. Factors which may cause this are: [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_provinces_growth]]food shortages[[/url]], taxation, the presence of rampaging enemy armies in a province, and [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_construction_culture]]cultural unrest[[/url]].
Our blades are turned, fall back! Flee!
Soldiers! Victory is ours! Your descendants will dine on your achievements here today! When he walks free, the Consul will bestow great privileges to you all! You make Rome proud!
With the rebels crushed, the rule of law in Rome now goes unquestioned. Silanus: despite your military background, it is time for you to take a full interest in civic affairs.
Another victory! Rome will salute your valour!
I give thanks to Poseidon! You have fought your first sea battle. Good!
Good! You show wisdom in using agents to achieve your aims!
Knowledge is worth more than gold! Well done for consulting the encyclopaedia!
That was nicely done.

Developing the capital chain allows a settlement to grow in size and stature. In the provincial capital, this boosts both economic output and rate of growth, but puts greater demand on its food supplies. In minor settlements, on the other hand, this chain represents the exploitation of an important local resource: as the settlement grows, resource production is increased and its economy and rate of growth improves.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0018_enc_page_campaign_play_military_stances#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_stances_raid]]Raid[[/url]] enemy trade routes to keep the income from reaching its wrongful destination. Remember though that attacking trade is an act of war!
Your army has reached a higher level of development. This is good!
Good work in looking at the encyclopaedia. Ignorance is, after all, rarely strength.
You show the cunning of Ba'al himself! Capturing the enemy siege weapons! Excellent!

When actively recruiting units into its ranks, an army is said to be “mustering”. Whilst in this stance it is immobile and cannot initiate an attack, but can defend and will replenish any losses at a quicker rate. An army cannot muster whilst undertaking a forced march, hiding to ambush or raiding.
Ready yourselves, my soldiers, for we go to meet the enemy once more! The first man over the walls will lead the Triumph in Rome! To battle!

As a unit fights and survives battles, it gains [[url:/manual/single-player/0028_enc_page_campaign_play_military_experience]]experience[[/url]] that improves its ability to deal with future combat situations. Amongst other things, experience increases morale, so an experienced unit is less likely to break and run from battle when under stress and fatigue.
All elements relating to the running of your faction are displayed on the faction management panel.
There they are! Harrass them with arrows and finish them with lances! They must not reach Carrhae!
The Romans have underestimated us yet again! Their pitiful trap has failed!
The Senate have lost patience with your failure to follow orders, Silanus. Your command has been stripped, and a more capable man will lead the push into Samnium. You are dismissed!
Congratulations, one of your agents has increased in rank.
This is good, the ways of our people take deep hold in this region! Well done!
Your general has increased in rank. This is a worthy thing.
Trade is the lifeblood of our people, and your diplomacy adds to their weath!
Most excellent! You are a proper son of Ba'al!

Pressing the [[url:/manual/single-player/0092j_enc_page_battle_play_interface_melee]]melee[[/url]] button locks the selected melee-capable units into melee mode. All attack orders will result in a hand-to-hand attack until you click on it again.
The Samnites siege engines fire on the city, weakening the will of the men within. If we can get to them we can halt the bombardment, but they are well guarded.
Excellent! In time, we will have plenty of troops to meet the Samnite advance.
Once again we do battle with our enemy. Present arms, men! For Rutilus! For Rome!
Well done. Rome's armies should be able to march where they are needed.
By the gods! You set up that ambush well!
Good! Athena, in her wisdom, would be proud of this new technology.
This general has increased in rank, thanks to your careful mastery.
You are a true reflection of Ba'al's greatness! You have completed an objective. Excellent!
Horus himself could not have done better!
Hold positions, men! We are here to guard this pass, not chase them back to Samnium!
Well done, you’ve captured an enemy province. Your empire has started to grow.
Jupiter would approve! Another vassal state bows to Roman might!
So, an objective achieved! May Zeus shower you with blessings!
A magnificent achievement, to ambush the enemy so successfully. Your might is worthy!
Be wary of firing on the enemy when your own units are engaged in melee with them, you risk wiping out your own men as well!
This forest will cover our approach if we move with care! The terrain is to our advantage!
The relief force is attacking, Commander! Man the barricades!
The Samnites are sending javelins against us. They mean to disrupt our line before their infantry engage.
An excellent choice. This man can guard the home front and marshal any garrisons that the rebels may attack.
Before starting the battle, have you considered deploying your force in one of these formations? The correct formation can make the difference between victory and defeat!
There is no better sight than an enemy humbled! We have vassals! Well done!
Don't forget that your units have a range of [[url:/manual/single-player/0085_enc_page_battle_play_phase_conflict_abilities]]abilities[[/url]] that can be used to improve their performance in battle.
The enemy phalanx is too strong! Regroup in the valley, men! We can cut our way to the coast and sail away from this place!
We have been overrun! Execution surely awaits us all! It has been an honour to serve with you, brother!
Have the siege weapons target the walls and the gate. They won't stand for long.
Very good! Your agent has risen in rank and serves you better!
Your agent now has a higher rank. Your efforts have been well rewarded!

Depending on your faction’s culture, the first decision in your campaign may be the selection of a party to represent, which may take the form of a family or tribe. Alternatively, you will be assigned one. Throughout the campaign you must manage your party’s power in relation to the others such as the Senate, court or tribal council. While it is possible to achieve a balance of power, you may choose to push your party forward to gain more or sit back and allow its standing to diminish. In a republic, both paths can lead to conflict, whilst in a tribe or monarchy any show weakness may be challenged, again leading to civil war.
The Samnites prepare their attack on the hillside. Their numbers are too strong for us to consider an engagement. I have enough men to defend a grain store, not assault an army.
The enemy elephants charge! A terrible sight!
As you are about to besiege a settlement, have you considered deploying in siege assault formation?
Excellent, you’ve forged a peace treaty, the war is over for now.
Excellent news, I think. Your agent now has a higher rank.
Peace? It is a good thing, for it allows men a little rest. Well done for this treaty.
Good. Your general has increased in rank and will now fight better.
This agent has improved in rank, thanks to your excellent efforts.
Egypt's glory grows ever greater! Well done! You have taken the settlement.
Grave news! Silanus has been wounded and carried from the field. The men lose heart!
Silanus is lost! All of Rome is in mourning! We cannot continue without his leadership. Take down the marching camps and signal the retreat!

As an alternative to straight-forward occupation, upon capture of a settlement there is also an option to loot it. Doing so adds a lump sum to your treasury, but there will be a greater public order penalty than that caused by occupation alone.
Do not count your arrows! Our baggage train carries many more, and can supply nearby units!
Well done, you’ve negotiated military access through the territory of another.
This peace treaty is a good thing for our people. Well done for this achievement.
You have the cunning of a desert fox! To escape such an ambush! Well done!
Tanit has blessed our people by sending you!

By mastering the transportation and storage of water, you can develop sewer systems in urban areas and irrigate your crops to significantly increase your wealth from agriculture. The sanitation chain enables the construction of buildings that affect hygiene and safety. Constructing them in your provincial capital enables you to improve public order and increase province growth.

The core of any army, an attack by highly-trained melee infantry often decides a battle, generally taking place once skirmishing and an initial charge by the frontline spearmen has occurred. Typically armed with swords, axes or clubs, with shields and armour for protection, the mobility of melee infantry makes them effective against slow-moving spearmen, whilst their armour is the crucial factor when facing other elite infantrymen. All non-spear infantry are vulnerable to cavalry charges, particularly to their flanks and rear.
Silanus has been hurt in the melee! He will live, but word will surely spread through the soldiers!
The faction summary tab gathers together essential statistics and information, enabling you to check the status of your campaign at a glance.
There are more arrows at the baggage train! Rearm, quickly!
You have crossed the seas! Well done. And Poseidon be thanked!
Good! Good! Our armies march where they will because of this treaty! Well done!
Good! The settlement is taken! This is excellent news.
The gods bless those who surprise the foe with a successful ambush! My congratulations!
A well-ordered charge! That’s the way to do it!
Superb! Ba'al enjoys seeing enemies crushed like that!
Rome's influence and power grow, Silanus. Word of our deeds spreads amongst people far from our shores.

It is possible to take a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]settlement[[/url]] without risking a pitched battle. A patient [[url:/manual/single-player/0047a_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_generals_admirals]]general[[/url]] can throttle the fight out of the defenders by laying siege for several turns. This is time-consuming, but eventually hunger or an angry populace will force a surrender.
The Romans approach Carrhae! They must not take the town!
Come, soldiers! Draw your weapons, raise a clamour and let the townsfolk know that Salernum gains its freedom this day! Now, advance!
Look sharp, my soldiers, another chance to win glory against our enemy beckons! Raise a cheer, men, we go to battle!

Since diplomacy with and war against other factions can only be undertaken when your respective territories are adjacent, you can increase your line of sight by sending fleets further along the coast or agents into unknown lands to encounter new factions. However, be careful not to go too far without back up, you may fall foul of hostile neighbours or suffer attrition if your ships stray too far from the coast.
Details of your faction's financial status, including taxation and trade, are displayed on the finance panel.
An army approaches! Tribune, I think the banners are Lucanian!
The new recruits have joined our army and are ready to be tested in battle. It will be a while before the Samnites arrive. We should take advantage of the delay and seek to further their training.
We can use our cavalry to chase them off. They remain hidden from the enemy behind this hill.
Good! One of your generals has a new household member or object.
Good work! Your army is replenished!
Well done. The army has been replenished.
Egyptian culture now dominates this region! Your efforts have been most worthy.
And now may the birds feast on your foes, Most Excellent One!
Superb! Mars would have been proud of a flanking attack like that!
Sir! Word has reached us that the enemy general is dead, killed by our men! The enemy will surely panic without their leader!
Roman power grows not just abroad, but in controlled territory as well. Edicts can be issued in major cities to promote the war effort at home.
Running everywhere with your cavalry lets them cover ground quickly, but they will get tired if you overdo it. Tired troops are less effective in combat.

This faction has now become your satrapy or client state, taking advantage of your military might in exchange for a percentage of their income and, in the case of satrapies, unlimited military access. However, satrapies may find themselves dragged into a conflict not of their own design. Unlike a regular ally, they cannot decline a request to assist when war is declared on their overlord without automatically declaring war on their overlord themselves.
Well done, you’ve captured an enemy region. You are closer to control of the entire province.
Good! Peace with honour is important to Rome right now. A peace treaty is welcome.
Ares approves of a man who can ambush like that! Well done!
Good work. This treaty makes us stronger. Our armies can now march in their lands.
A small thing, but worthy of celebration! Your general has a new household member or object.
Were it not presumptious, I would call you Ba'al's most precious servant!
I give thanks to Amun Ra for your wisdom in command!
Excellent! Weapons and armour are always good investments in times of war.
Placing your general in close proximity to his men has a morale-boosting influence on them.
A prize above mere gold! Your efforts with this general have gained him a household member or object.
Our ways are dominant in this region! We must celebrate your achievement!
A military treaty that lets our armies march freely is most welcome. You have done Carthage a great service.
If an infantry unit is about to be charged by cavalry, make sure it is stationary. That way, the men can brace themselves against the impact and will take fewer losses.
The enemy have wounded our general, commander, and he can no longer influence the battle! The news has already reached the men, they are disheartened!
The enemy are bereft, their elephants lie slain! Now they advance on foot!
Proconsul, the Senate have requested that you enter into negotiations with the Greeks to the south. A trade agreement would bring prosperity to both peoples and aid the war effort.
Kill every Samnite you find, men, give no quarter! Scour the city, Rutilus must be found, alive or dead.
Athena gave you wisdom in the choice you made. Well done for solving this dilemma!
Good! Thanks to your efforts, your general has gained a household member or object.
The ways of our people take deep hold in this province! Good!
By the flame! You have won your first battle! Well done!
Praise the Lady, and well done! You have crossed the seas with your army!
Well done! The settlement is yours! I thank Ba'al Hammon that he has given us such a leader!

Whilst your armies protect threatened regions, your settlements have their own local garrisons to act as rudimentary defence forces. These men are stationed within a settlement and cannot leave their posts to join your armies on campaign. The types of garrison troops available depend on the buildings constructed in a particular settlement. Whilst not the most skilled soldiers, garrisons who defend against besieging forces will develop strength and experience over time. Ports have an equivalent garrison navy to protect against raids and naval blockades.
Pompey cowers on that hill, it is up to us to seize the initiative and take the fight to him. For the glory of Rome!
All of Egypt will welcome this peace! Well done.
You show cunning and fortitude in equal measure, fighting off such an ambush! Well done!
By all the gods! You show promise!
And that, my lord, shows that you are entirely worthy of command!

A general will often go into battle accompanied by a mounted bodyguard, although some factions can attach them to a unit of powerful, elite infantry instead. A skilled general can affect the battle by his very presence. While his command unit is strong in melee, the general himself will have less influence on his army if he is personally involved in the fighting. Depending on the skills at his disposal, he can inspire and rally his men, and even improve the abilities of individual units.
Be wary when attacking an enemy with their backs to the hills. Expect them to withdraw to the high ground.

Generals can inspire a single unit to increase the violence of their melee attack, improve reload rate and rate of fire, and ensure the unit's morale does not break for the duration of the effect. Select your general and then right-click on a unit. If the unit is not standing within the radius of his influence your general will move closer until it is. Once targeted, the unit will be inspired for a short time before the ability burns out.

In order to construct a [[url:/manual/single-player/0038_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_diplomacy]]proposal[[/url]] double-click on a faction from the list, and then add diplomatic options by clicking on the add offer or demand buttons and selecting one. The proposed deal will take shape on the negotiation table. Click on the button next to an option to remove it from a deal. When ready, click on the propose offer button.
Our slingers can be placed upon the hill to rain fire upon the enemy below. Keep them out of the fray!
Look fast, the tribes attack once more!
Ha! They flee, the Roman dogs. Victory is ours!
General! The enemy are sending their cavalry force at our flank. They seek to overwhelm us! We must act!
Commander, word reaches us that Scipio himself has been hurt in the fighting and has been taken from the field! This news will surely demoralize the men!
Congratulations, one of your generals has gained a household member or object.
By Mars, well done! Successful ambushes are not easy!
Your diplomacy has worked! Allies are a blessing from Zeus!
Truly, Bellona's blessings have been showered upon you!
Tribune Silanus, the men are reporting sounds of a skirmish ahead of our position!
The men have started work on a fortified encampment. It will be a while before the Samnites arrive. We should take advantage of the delay and seek to further their training. See to it.
General! The Egyptians line up against us on the high ground. We must find a way to drive them off!
Excellent, your general has gained a skill.
Well done! After your first battle, may count yourself a son of Mars!
By Athena and Ares, good work! Ambushes are tricky things to pull off!
Egyptian culture now dominates this province! A thousand blessings from Amun Ra for your efforts!
Ba'al Hammon will be pleased, for Carthaginian ways are dominant in this region.

When an army attempts to cross the sea, a transport ship is automatically supplied to provide passage. While these ships are similar to military vessels, they are slower, more cumbersome and are unable to withstand sustained damage. With that in mind, transport ships require the protection of your fleets if they are to transport large armies across the sea. Selecting a fleet and right-clicking on a transport provides an armed escort for the journey: any attacks on the transport will have to face the fleet first.

Lightly-armoured and armed with swords or spears, medium and light cavalry have good mobility and speed, making them an ideal force to screen and attack from the flanks of their army. Whilst they lack the punch required to make a frontal attack on an organised line, melee cavalry can be effective when charging its flanks or rear, or against a disordered or broken enemy. They can also be used to mercilessly chase down routers as they flee from the battle.
Antagonism stalks the towns and farmsteads of this province, Proconsul. Action must be taken to appease the populace before they revolt.

This option is used to broker trade agreements. Once agreed, a trade route is opened between your territory and that of your trade partner, enabling goods to be traded for mutual advantage and profit. There is no limit to the number of trade routes a faction can have.
Defeat! Damn Hannibal and his accursed kin! When will this war end?
We gave battle, so we must show aggression. Defeat the enemy army or capture the settlement to claim victory!

[[url:/manual/single-player/0048_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_spies]]Spies[[/url]] are subterfuge experts, recruited via the Hire Agents button when a settlement is selected. They can be recruited anywhere in your empire and are invisible to the enemy until detected. Spies are vulnerable to [[url:/manual/single-player/0050_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_champions]]champions[[/url]] and exceptionally effective against [[url:/manual/single-player/0049_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_dignitaries]]dignitaries[[/url]].
Excellent, you’ve used an ability in battle.
Good. The army is replenished and ready to fight for Rome.
Excellent. Ba'al Hammon has given you wisdom when dealing with this dilemma.
By the fires, you commanded well!

If your party becomes too powerful in a republic, mistrust and paranoia ultimately lead to a challenge for control of your faction. At this point, civil war ensues; the remaining parties unite and lead rebel forces to capture the capital and overthrow your regime. Similarly, should you be deemed too weak, you may be exiled as an enemy of the state, with little choice but to lead your armies against the usurpers in the capital. In a tribal society or a monarchy, your tribe or family branch could be challenged should they be deemed weak, again leading to civil war.
