Such conflicts can only continue for a limited time, at which point they are automatically resolved by treaty, the terms of which are decided by the balance of power at the point of resolution.

Heavily-armoured and armed with lances, these prestigious cavalry units should be kept in reserve and used sparingly so their impact is decisive. A cavalry charge into infantry lines can be devastating, but their intervention must be carefully timed to inflict maximum damage on the enemy. Despite their armour, shock cavalry should generally be kept clear of spearmen and are best used to charge weakened or disordered points in an enemy line. The heaviness of their armour means they will tire when engaged in prolonged melee combat, so, ideally, they should be withdrawn once their initial charge has hit home.
The treasury is empty, Silanus! There is no money to pay the men, horses go hungry and buildings fall into disrepair! Something must be done!
We have failed the King. Pah! Let the Roman devils have this sand.
The enemy commit their whole force to the west approach! We must hit them in the flank if we can!
Advance the cavalry to the side of our position. Keep them concealed: use the brow of the hill, or the forest, as cover!
You have captured the province! Would that there were wealth enough to properly reward you!
Most excellent. The army is replenished, and can continue Egypt's struggles.
I salute you! Your general has a new skill!

Your party can gain power by completing missions, winning victories on the battlefield, and through political machinations back home. Generals with some experience can be left to lead your armies and fleets or be granted political office. While offices cause a gradual increase, a successful general provides a major boost to your party’s power during wartime. Although power can be left to accumulate, it can also be used to carry out agent actions, such as assassination, aimed at undermining the power of another party within your faction.
We have one season to prepare for the Samnite attack, Silanus. Let us fortify our position.

Total War: ROME II contains an encyclopaedia function containing detailed information about all aspects of the game, including units, buildings, technologies and sections on how to play. It can be accessed at any time from the dedicated button in the top left-hand corner of the campaign map or battlefield and via the question mark buttons on most panels.
The enemy cavalry are routing, now is the time to attack!
The ambush is in place, commander!
Comrades! We march on the enemy's capital to free our leader! These men stand in your way - show them no mercy!
As you are defending a river crossing, have you considered deploying in river defence formation?
Congratulations, you’ve replenished your army.
Our culture dominates this province! Most excellent, and something to celebrate!
Our city is under siege! March to its relief, quickly!
This is it, the attack begins! Carthage falls today!
Excellent! This man is a standard-bearer for Roman martial valour and an inspiration to the men.

A flanking force of cavalry can be a serious threat to the enemy, but a mixed force of cavalry and infantry, although slower, is more dangerous. Your infantry can engage theirs, leaving your cavalry free to kill.
Reinforcements! Our allies, Roman and Lucanian, rally to our aid! Take heart men, the gods are with us!
More Gauls attack our position! They threaten to engulf us!
Well done, you’ve fought your first battle!
A trade treaty is most welcome! You have done well.
Your might is a credit to our people! You have taken an entire province!
Thanks to you, this general has a new skill! Excellent! Prize this!
Egypt benefits from good agents, so this new skill is good news.
Command like this, and the omens for the future are most favourable!
A fine diplomatic manoeuvre! Athena herself would appreciate the wit!
The enemy commander is slain, general, cursing your name with his dying breaths! Let us send his army after him!

A [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]] consists of up to four regions, each one containing a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_provinces]]settlement[[/url]], the hub of activity within it. One of these is always the provincial capital, a [[url:/manual/single-player/0021_enc_page_campaign_play_military_sieges]]major[[/url]], walled settlement, whilst the remainder are minor settlements without defensive walls.
The Samnite capital has fallen, they are lost! Roman strength and courage have won this war! Glory to Rome!
Good news. Jupiter has given your general a new skill!
Mars be thanked for your skills! You fought off the ambushers!
You defeated the ambush! Ares be thanked for your war skills!
Your first battle! Your sword is blooded! Well done!
Your general yet lives! This is most excellent!
Superb! Like the desert fox you hunt with cunning!

Each faction has ultimate objectives that they must complete to achieve victory. There are, however, three distinct routes that can be taken: military, cultural and economic. Primary objectives provide milestones, steering your faction towards its ultimate aim. Each of these is accompanied by a set of bonus objectives, inspired by historical precedence. Whilst completing them gives your faction further advantages, they are entirely optional.
The enemy general has been dragged to the ground and run through! Word of his death will spread through the enemy and do our work for us.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance#enc_text_manual_hud_finances]]Taxes[[/url]] are set at a faction-wide level, not by individual [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]]. Keeping taxes at high levels for protracted lengths of time makes people [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order]]unhappy[[/url]] and reduces future economic growth.
There are currently no troops stationed in this region, leaving it open to conquest by an aggressive neighbour.
Use the space bar to speed up the movement of all characters, armies or fleets on the campaign map. Press the space bar again to slow them down again.

Your enemies have [[url:/manual/single-player/0022_enc_page_campaign_play_military_ambush]]ambushed[[/url]] you! As you have been taken by surprise, there will not be time to move your army until the fighting starts. Also, be aware that the enemy may attack from both sides of the road, so you may need to defend in two directions simultaneously.
Look to the rear! Berserkers!
Capua will surely fall under another siege. There is a pass to the south which guards the entrance to the Campanian plain. We shall march out and await the enemy.
Varro is dead! Press his men back! Back into the river!
Well done, you’ve recruited a unit to your army.
Well done, you have survived the enemy’s ambush of your army.
Good work! A full treasury is the mark of a wise Roman leader!
You have done well. It is wise to use our agents.
You show wisdom in looking at the encyclopaedia. Ba'al Hammon values wisdom.
By Tanit's sacred bosom! That was neatly done!
By Isis! That was neatly done!

Barbarian factions of shared cultural heritage are able to form or join confederations in order to pool their strongest elements for the common good. Those that do merge with it and cease to exist as single entities until liberated from the agreement. The option to form a confederation is a diplomatic option and, upon creation, other factions of the same subculture are invited to join, regardless of whether or not they are at war with another member. Any faction at war with a new member is given the option to declare war on the entire confederation.
Be sure to live off the land when campaigning far from home, Proconsul. Maintaining an army in enemy territory is expensive.
The rigours of campaigning can reshape any man. Monitor the careers of those you lead, Proconsul, and consider how they may be best employed for Rome.

A blockade is a cordon of ships that prevents any trade going through a port whilst it is in place and any fleet moored there from escaping without fighting a battle. It can be broken by an attack on the blockading fleet. You can blockade a port by right-clicking on it. If there is an enemy fleet inside, a cordon graphic will appear to indicate a blockade is under way. Otherwise, your fleet will sail straight into the port and occupy it.

There is a degree of unrest in this province as the majority of the population follow a different [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_construction_culture]]culture[[/url]] to your own. Send [[url:/manual/single-player/0049_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_dignitaries]]dignitaries[[/url]] to promote your culture here.

A character's [[url:/manual/single-player/0053_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_ancillaries]]household[[/url]] is the objects, assistants and general hangers-on that he or she accumulates whilst carrying out their tasks, and which in-turn affect their [[url:/manual/single-player/0028_enc_page_campaign_play_military_experience]]abilities[[/url]]. They are acquired as the campaign progresses and can be assigned to a [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]character[[/url]] or placed in reserve for later use.
The enemy is not yet fully deployed in the east. Crush them before they can form up!
Excellent, you have successfully ambushed an enemy army.
Victory!

Some events present a [[url:/manual/single-player/0040_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_missions]]dilemma[[/url]], which will open automatically and require a decision to be made before you can continue. Choose carefully as the wrong decision may have serious consequences for your faction.
Silanus! Capua needs our urgent assistance! Will you not act?
Crassus' men flee the field! These Romans are pathetic!

We cannot train further recruits, the treasury is just too stretched to support greater numbers. Word may have reached you of some minor concerns regarding Rome's finances, but do not let them distract you from your military duties.

Survey the campaign map using the W, A, S and D keys. Q and E rotate the camera. You can also hold down the middle mouse button and drag it to scout around, using the Z and X keys, or your mousewheel, to zoom in. Left-clicking on a settlement, army or agent selects it; all orders are issued by right-clicking on your chosen target.
Congratulations, you’ve completed a mission.
Good! Rome needs loyal servants such as this new agent.

Once groups of units have been formed, you can assign set formations to them. The Group Formations button locks selected units into a formation. Each available formation enables the effective implementation of a tactic, instantly forming your army up to maximise its strengths or exploit a weakness in the enemy. Formations can be assigned at any point during a battle, but are best set up during the deployment phase. Units in formation will maintain their fixed shape and spacing whilst carrying out orders.

Experience for ship crews works in the same way as it does for units, except that when a ship is unable to continue fighting – either due to surrender, routing or destruction - all remaining experience points that its crew might have earned are instead split between the ships it fought against.
The phalanx is too strong! Our men shall not be able hold this ground much longer.
Varus has fallen! Every man for himself! Run for your lives!
This battle is lost, commander! We must leave the field while we still can!

Units can be [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruited[[/url]] directly to an army, either in the field or when garrisoning a settlement, although only those troop types available in the [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]region[[/url]] he is currently standing in are displayed - it is not possible to draw in recruits from other regions. Select the recruit units button to start [[url:/manual/single-player/0018_enc_page_campaign_play_military_stances]]mustering[[/url]] your force.
Splendid! You have achieved one of the campaign objectives!
The gods love a man who can use trickery! A fine ambush!
Your wise talk has secured us some allies! Well done!
You are blessed with mastery of gold, I see. Well done! The treasury shows a profit!
A new unit. Carthage needs strong defences, so your action was wise.
By Horus and Apollo, you show signs of promise!
Fine diplomatic work! The Senate appreciate good politics!

Buildings directly influence the types and number of units available for recruitment. By developing the military chain, new, more advanced units become available. This does, however, come at a cost, as military buildings are a cause of squalor, which in turn impacts public order.
Soldiers, draw swords! Let us show our foes what it means to be Roman!
Commander, grave news! The Consul has fallen and the settlement is being overrun! Let us make a retreat while we have our lives!
Hannibal has been knocked from his horse and carried from the field! His presence no longer rallies the men, they are disheartened!
Pompey’s legions have arrived and are preparing to attack! We must commit some men to the rear!

Capua has fallen! Panic grips the streets of Rome, men stockpile their coins and rush to make weapons and shields out of anything that falls to hand. The senate have lost confidence in your leadership, Silanus, and have moved to replace you. Your command is rescinded!

When you selected a faction, you also chose a family or party to represent within its [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics]]political[[/url]] system. Your faction leader is the head of the party you chose. Many [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]characters[[/url]] and subjects in your campaign contribute [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_gravitas]]gravitas[[/url]] to your party's overall power.
Excellent, you’ve recruited an agent.
By the gods, the agent did all that was required! Well done!
You have done well to find some shield-brothers to stand with us as allies.
You demonstrate wisdom once again! A mission done! The gods bless us through you!
Ba'al Hammon smiles at this turn of events! You have wiped out this faction! Good!

In addition to [[url:/manual/single-player/0051_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_skills]]skills[[/url]] gained through experience, characters develop [[url:/manual/single-player/0052_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_traits]]traits[[/url]] that affect their abilities. Some traits are present from the beginning, others are acquired as a [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]character[[/url]] progresses through the campaign.
Go! Get the standards out! The legions do not fail!
Tribune! The village is lost! What hope have we of saving Capua?
This cruel fate shall not befall Rome! Samnium shall be ground to dust, I swear this to Jupiter!
The Macedonian left is decimated commander! Their right wing still fights on; let us come about and hit their flanks!
Pompey's legions lose the will to fight! Put them to the sword, kill them all!
After a heroic or crushing victory a commemorative statue will appear on the campaign map at the site of the battle. Mouse over it to see a tooltip containing the details.
A new technology. Good! The gods value cleverness as highly as a strong sword arm!
You have brought your army safely to dry land! Well done!
A new agent. Ba'al Hammon can never have too many servants. Well done.
You are wise to work in the shadows and use agents. Good… Good…
Good work. Mars has a fine follower in you!

Agents are recruited directly from a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]] via the recruitment tab on the review panel. [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]Recruitment[[/url]] is instant, but cost may vary depending on a number of factors, such as the presence of certain buildings, faction or [[url:/manual/single-player/0052_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_traits]]character traits[[/url]].

Ports do not just facilitate [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance]]trade[[/url]] income, they also enable the construction of naval vessels. Note that ships can also be ordered directly from fleets.
Well done, you’ve captured a settlement belonging to an enemy faction.
It is good to see former rivals kneeling in the dust as vassals! Congratulations.
Egypt will be well served by this new agent. Well done.
Close ranks, men, and present arms! The enemy is upon us! Now is our chance for glory!
Congratulations on your promotion, Propraetor, it was not before time. I am pleased to report that the men are ready to deploy for battle, despite the foul weather we have been dealt.
Our army must construct boats before setting sail. This may take some time.

The road to Bovianum is clear, Proconsul. Their capital will be fortified; we’ll need siege engines if we are to capture it. Weapons such as rams and ladders are constructed when the city is under siege.
Well done. A new building. Architecture should be a Greek strength.
Excellent! The treasury is full, and you should take the credit!
By the Goat of Mendes, you have done well here!
So, then, you captured a ship. The blessings of the Lady upon you.

The order in which reinforcements take to the battlefield can be determined by left-clicking and dragging units into the order of your choice - the unit on the far left being the first to take the field.
Alright men, listen up! We are up against it. The Samnites have moved to attack and it's too late to attempt to cross to intercept them.
Good, we have blocked the road to Rome. The Samnite attack must come through here. Our depleted army can replenish over time while we await their arrival.
When assaulting a settlement, remember that many types of troop can scale enemy walls. Select a unit, then right-click on a section of wall to order the troops to climb the wall.
Tribune, our allies begin to crumble! Hope is fading!
General Flamininus has been knocked from his horse and is receiving treatment off the field! The men lose heart!
We are overwhelmed. Retreat!
Men carrying ladders can be used to scale the city walls, those manning the battering ram can be ordered to smash the gate. They will be vulnerable to missile fire, so need protection!
Congratulations, your culture is now predominant in this region.
Victory is ours, commander! What you do with the captured men is up to you. As slaves, they will fetch a handsome price, but the message sent by either clemency or brutality can be worth more.
Your glittering diplomacy has secured a trade agreement. Well done.
Amun Ra smiles on you! You have wiped out these rivals! A blessing on you!
Your rivals kneel as new vassals of Carthage! I give thanks to Ba'al for you!
Fine diplomatic work! Our people appreciate your efforts!

Religious buildings reflect the part of the gods in the development of their people. The religious chain enables the construction of temples and shrines that tap into almost every aspect of daily life, from improving public order and increasing trade income to spreading cultural influence.
Our enemies drop their shields and run for their very lives! Victory belongs to Rome!

Rome is taken! Our great city is burned, and our people scattered to every corner of the land! The Senate has reconvened in Capua and its first order of business is to find a competent leader to replace you, Silanus! You are hereby exiled!
Well done, you’ve completed one of your faction’s campaign objectives.
The objective is achieved. Your march to power continues. You do well.
A successful ambush! Ah, the gods have gifted you with courage and trickery!
All praise to you! An objective achieved is worthy indeed!
The agent who works quietly and succeeds also serves Ba'al Hammon. Well done!

It is possible to increase or decrease the length of a unit’s rank and file by holding down the right mouse button and dragging it until the desired width and depth has been achieved. Alternatively, hold down the Ctrl key and use the up or down cursor keys to get the same result. The entire unit can then be moved about the battlefield without changing its shape by left-clicking and dragging it to the desired location once the cursor has changed to a movement cross. This can also be done with the cursor keys. It is also possible to rotate a unit or group of units around their central axis by holding down the left mouse button until the cursor changes, pressing the Ctrl key, and moving the mouse or using the left and right cursor keys until the ideal orientation is found.
The peoples of this region are hostile to our rule, Silanus, their animosity fed by their strange beliefs and backwards customs. Be sure to keep them in check.

Income is dependent on the market value of the [[url:/resources]]goods[[/url]] produced, which is in turn dependent on supply and demand across all factions and foreign [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance]]trade[[/url]] partners. For up-to-date information, check the trade tab.
Holding some cavalry in reserve at the centre gives you flexibility. As the battle takes shape you can move them quickly to where they are needed.
Funds are deducted from your treasury at the beginning of each turn to pay for the supplies and wages of your faction's troops. This is known as unit upkeep.

Your faction's produce can be [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance]]traded[[/url]] with other factions once you've set up a trade agreement between you via [[url:/manual/single-player/0038_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_diplomacy]]diplomacy[[/url]]. Once an agreement is in place, a trade route to that faction will appear on the map. Your sea routes are displayed yellow, those of neutral factions are white, and those belonging to enemies are red. Land trade is represented by ox and cart in northern regions and camels in the south and east. There is no limit to the number of routes that your faction can set up.
Spartacus has been injured in the fighting! The men’s morale is crushed!
Silanus! We are at war and you dither in your duty! Salernum is there for the taking! Attack now!
Congratulations on your diplomacy! You have served Rome well by gaining an ally.
Good! The gods inspired you to make the right choice for this dilemma!
Excellent! Excellent! Jupiter smiles when Rome's enemies are utterly destroyed!
A rival falls to the assassin's skill! Well done!
Thoth has given you wisdom in sorting out this dilemma. Well done!
A new technology. The glory of Carthage is enhanced by your efforts!
Ba'al blesses us through you! A mission completed is a worthy thing!

A peace treaty can be negotiated to formally end the conflict between two warring factions. Ending a war not only affects relations between the factions involved, but also any allied factions who agreed or were obligated to join the conflict. Once peace has been established, diplomatic relations can be improved, enabling further agreements to be made between the participants. However, as we all know, peace is a fragile, often temporary, state easily brought to an end through further acts of aggression.

Fresh units may only be recruited into an army in controlled territory. Mercenaries, however, may be enlisted at any location. We should consider hiring additional strength as our campaign progresses.
You can judge the progress of a boarding action with the boarding action meter that appears above the ships involved.
This region is becoming poorer and poorer. You must reduce the tax burden here lest the people starve!
Mounted reinforcements from Brundisium are entering the southern pass! They look to overrun us! Victory or death my brothers!
The following fixed items can be set up during the deployment phase to aid your attack or defence: barricades, brimstone, fireballs, sharp stones, spike traps, stakes, and sudes.
Congratulations on a splendid piece of diplomacy, you now have an ally to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with you.
Excellent, you’ve crossed the sea with an army.
Zeus and Ares will laugh to see these people destroyed! Well done!
You have crossed the treacherous seas at the head of an army! Well done!
Ba'al must have inspired you! Your ambush was truly cunning!
Those who rebel against Ba'al Hammon deserve only the sword! Well done!

This is the skill tree, where the experience points gained by characters during the campaign can be used to select useful skills. As a character improves, they gain experience points that gradually increase their rank and therefore the skills available to them.
The battlefield is lost! Regroup at the coast! Save yourselves!

Good! Our camp blocks this road and while we hold this position, the enemy cannot pass. Deploy the infantry in a line facing down the valley, so that each unit covers the flank of the next. See to it.
A wise desert stratagem! And a fine ambush! Well done!

Locking your ships into a formation ensures that they stay ordered whilst maintaining their spacing. Select multiple ships and then press the Group Formation button to select one. Formations range from simple line formations or more complex setups, designed to maximise the effectiveness of your fleet. Press the G key or the Group formation Button again to dismiss a group once formed or give a ship a separate order to remove it from its group.

From the time an army is first mustered its [[url:/manual/single-player/0029_enc_page_campaign_play_military_legacies]]legacy[[/url]] and traditions are created through its actions in the field, enabling the development of [[url:/manual/single-player/0051_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_skills]]skills[[/url]] in a similar way to those acquired by [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]characters[[/url]]. When a new army is raised, you can choose to hand down the legacy of a former army to your newest recruits.
Tire your enemy out by keeping them constantly occupied. Make them rush about by offering some advantage, for example by moving fast light troops into a vulnerable position.

Some regions contain resources or cultural specialities that enable the construction of special buildings, the type of which depends on the speciality of the region. They are constructed in exactly the same way as any other building, yet confer special bonuses or provide key resources.
Avoid charging your cavalry into the front of spear units, they will always come off worse. Always attack their rear or flanks for maximum effect.
Tribune Silanus! The Samnite army are massed on the hills around Capua. They are preparing an attack - see for yourself!
We have one season to prepare for the Samnite attack. Let us recruit more mounted troops. Once we gut their army I don't want any of them escaping the field alive.
The Legions break with nowhere to run! Cut them down! Rome is as good as ours!

[[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics#enc_text_politics_gravitas]]Gravitas[[/url]] is the accumulated popularity and standing of a [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]character[[/url]] in the Roman world. It gradually increases or decreases over time through military victories, crushing defeats, and his actions during missions or as the subject of [[url:/manual/single-player/0040_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_missions]]dilemmas[[/url]]. When a certain level is reached the character becomes important enough to take part in [[url:/manual/single-player/0037_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_politics]]politics[[/url]].
You’ve researched technology, very soon you will have the edge over all your rivals.
A new technology. The Senate will be pleased your work to further Rome's intellectual greatness.
Good! You have crossed the sea with an army! Dry land: most welcome!
A new technology. The gods bless those who seek for knowledge! Well done!
Dead by assassination, then. So fall all enemies of Ba'al. Well done!
Fine diplomatic work! The gods appreciate good politics!
The enemy phalanx are beaten and they run from the field! Rejoice men, the day is ours!
You have done well. Trade and wealth are needed by Rome.
Like a desert storm, you have struck! A most excellent ambush, my lord!
A new ally. Your diplomatic efforts are much appreciated by the people.

Trade agreements are hugely profitable for the factions involved. Once an agreement is in place, a trade route is established between the two, with any ports or settlements along it receiving a share of the income. The trade of natural resources influences their global prices by the law of supply and demand. Trade agreements continue until one party breaks the agreement, suffering a penalty to their diplomatic relations.
Our enemy gains ground against us, Silanus! Re-double your efforts!

It is possible to cycle back through advice that has already been displayed by use of the back button on this user interface. Words that are highlighted and underlined are hyperlinks to encyclopaedia pages containing further details about that particular topic. Left-click on the advisor's portrait to replay the message currently on-screen.
Berserkers! Brace Yourselves!
The river crossings here have been destroyed by the defenders. May the Gods be with them should the enemy attack.
The Samnite capital is in sight, finally! Siege engineers, muster your equipment. If Rutilus is alive we will find him soon!
Congratulations, you’ve set up a trade agreement with another faction.
You have done well to walk the path of wisdom in the dilemma.
A successful ambush! What is not to like, and to praise? My congratulations!
To see rivals kneel as vassals! Amun Ra will bless you for this!
Good work. I will offer sacrifice to Ba'al to thank him for your wisdom.
It is of obvious benefit to build forces rapidly in times of war. Our barracks are large enough to train multiple units at once.
Your are leaving a settlement undefended; doing so could lead to its capture and the destruction of the faction before your campaign has even begun!
This list shows events in the order they occurred. It can be sorted by their names. Click on one to learn more about it. When an important event occurs it will open automatically.
The enemy siege weapons are still troublesome, but now the Samnites have left them relatively unguarded. Let us strike there!
Commander! Now is the time to strike and defeat Carthage!
An expedition to the south is problematic: it will leave Rome wide open to a counter-attack. Another army must be recruited to stand guard. A new commander must be appointed.
Congratulations, one of your generals has increased in rank.
Congratulations, your culture is now predominant in this province.
Good work. You are a true son of Mars!

You can further invest in your military forces by exploring the training chain in any provincial capital. This enables the construction of buildings that give bonuses to all areas of your military, whether they be infantry, cavalry, or siege weapons and equipment.
The enemy are broken, they turn and run! This battle is ours!

Naval battles are frequently a series of individual duels between ships, but there is value in maintaining formation and contact with the admiral for as long as possible. The morale-boosting effect of being close to the flagship can be passed from ship to ship, as long as they are within hailing distance of each other.
Let us also add to our strength and recruit more troops.
Good. You have a new unit in the army.
Good! Our people will enjoy the wealth from this trade agreement.
A sea crossing carried out by your army, and well too! You have cause for pride, I think!
Well done! To fight off an ambush is the act of a mighty warrior!
You show the wisdom of the fire in your decision over this dilemma. Well done.
A good deal! That is what diplomacy should be about!
Do you see your enemy, men? The cowards run, they have no more will to fight! Victory is ours!
Avoid approaching places surrounded by heights, where troops can be entrapped and cut off, or where the land is sunken. Keep your distance and draw the enemy towards these areas.

The riot in this province has grown into an armed [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellion[[/url]]! There is no time to negotiate a peaceful solution now, you must send troops to defeat the rebels at once!
The Consul and his remaining forces have garrisoned the city. Laenas means to stop any assault at the river, but he is vastly outnumbered. I fear he will be overwhelmed!
Pick up your weapons, men, the enemy are upon us! A hundred denarii to the man who brings me the enemy general's sash! To battle!
Keep fighting men! Live or die, we will find glory!
Attacking spear-equipped infantry from the front is a good way to kill off your cavalry units. Attack from the flank or rear - or better still, use infantry!
A new agent. It is wise to have such services available.
The mission is complete. I give thanks for your efforts!
You have taken the settlement! Well done! You are a worthy commander!
Trade and wealth are always welcome. Well done for securing this treaty.
Good work. I will sacrifice to Amun Ra to ensure your continued wisdom!
Mars himself could not have done that better!

The agricultural chain enables the construction of food production buildings in minor settlements. These buildings span areas such as farming and animal husbandry, to increase the rate food is produced, whilst also influencing factors such as province growth. Sadly, agricultural buildings also come at a cost: they introduce pollution and filth that can lead to squalor, which, in turn, negatively affects public order.

Missile troops are excellent skirmishers, peppering the enemy line from a distance to break their formation and create opportunities for heavier infantry to exploit. Armed with javelins, bows or slings, they can stay a safe distance from the enemy by using their skirmish ability, as they are ill-equipped for prolongued melee. Especially vulnerable to enemy cavalry, you should consider using your own horsemen to keep your skirmishers screened and protected.

Your army has suffered casualties and requires fresh recruits to [[url:/manual/single-player/0026_enc_page_campaign_play_military_replenish]]replenish[[/url]] troop numbers. If an army is in a friendly province and not undertaking a forced march, unit replenishment will occur automatically. The rate of replenishment is enhanced when an army is [[url:/manual/single-player/0018_enc_page_campaign_play_military_stances#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_stances_muster]]mustering[[/url]]. The closer an army is to a province containing fresh recruits, the faster the rate of replenishment will be. If no replenishment occurs it may be because the army is on enemy territory or within an area of attrition.
Come, men! The Samnites cower behind their walls, but they know the end draws near for them! Bovianum will fall today!
Good news indeed. Your general has increased in rank.
You have a treaty that allows our armies to march into other lands. Excellent!
You have the courage of a desert lion! To fight off an ambush! Extraordinary!
The Senate now request a demonstration of the authority for which you are so acclaimed, Silanus. At times I will interject with advice but from here, you must take the lead.
If an army has to be stationary for a turn or more it can be fortified to protect itself from attack, meaning it will have had time to prepare and deploy defences on the field.

In order to move the entire force make sure a [[url:/manual/single-player/0047a_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_generals_admirals]]general[[/url]] is present, select the settlement or the general, and right-click on the point you wish to move to. When you release the cursor the army will walk to the chosen spot.
You have recruited so many units the treasury is buckling under the weight of their upkeep. Capturing new territory would spread the cost, as well as putting your troops to good use!
To disembark an army or character onto land select its transport ship, mouse over the coast and right-click.

Up to four camera bookmarks can be set up to navigate between points on the campaign map. Place the camera over the desired location and press Shift + F9 to F12 to set a bookmark. Simply press the relevant F key to view a bookmark. Bookmarks cannot be deleted, only overwritten with new ones.

All armies and fleets have a zone of control represented by the circle displayed around them. You can enter a zone of control if you are not at war with the controlling faction. It is possible to declare war once you are inside the zone.
If you're going to make a flanking move, try to pick a route where your force won't be visible for as long as possible - behind a hill, or behind or through woods.
Some Romans in this village have been confronted by Samnites. They are outnumbered but our troops can tip the balance. Move out!
Destroy those siege weapons, men! For Capua!
Pompey's legions are no match for our veterans. Look how they flee!

Let them go, my soldiers! Let them run back to their mountain hideaways and prepare their barricades! They have felt the strength of Rome, and will feel it again when we come for Rutilus! Rejoice, for we are victorious!
The Samnite fleet is beaten! Put to shore, men, let's take this place for Rome!
Excellent, your agent has gained a skill.
You show promise! Roman culture is now established in this region!
Congratulations! Honest Greek culture now prevails in this region!
By the fires! Our enemies flee! Well done! That was a superb charge!
This is good news. The agent has a new skill.
The culture of Carthage now holds sway in this province. Your efforts have been worthy!
Excellent! One moment of deceit has saved much blood!

Spy, dignitary and champion agents have unique abilities that significantly impact your campaign. Generally, they are used directly, but can also be activated simply by an agent's presence in a province, region or within an army. Every agent has a series of attributes, split into three categories: cunning, authority and zeal, which offer different approaches to actions upon the same target and shape the outcomes of those actions. These range from “astonishing success” to “critical failure”, resulting in wounds that force it out of play to convalesce or cause its death.
Public order has hit rock-bottom and the people here are in open revolt, Silanus! We have no choice now but to send armed forces to quell the uprising!
The Samnites make their retreat! The day is ours!
Commander! The Egyptian king has evacuated the field. His men are disheartened!
The gods love peace with honour, so well done in this matter! The treaty is welcome.
Excellent! Your general has a higher rank!
Very good! Your general has a new skill, thanks to you.
You have taken a region! A most worthy thing, to be sure, and may it soon be the province!
Excellent! Excellent! An attack in the rear always hurts!

Subjects are characters that take part in the your faction’s life and politics. Appearing throughout the game in political dilemmas, they provide a range of bonuses or penalties that can be increased or decreased depending on what you choose to do with them. If a subject dies his effects are removed from the campaign. There is also a chance this will happen if you threaten him, blackmail him, or if he starts to support your party.
Our general has fallen, dragged down in the fighting! How could this have happened? The men will panic when they hear!
Tribune Silanus, grave news! The Consul has fallen in the fighting and is badly wounded! Come quickly!
Your wisdom has opened many a road for our armies with this treaty.
Your general has survived! I shall drink to your continued success!
Your efforts with this general are rewarded: he has a new trait! Good!
Good. You have served Ba'al Hammon well in securing a peace treaty.
This general now has a higher rank. Well done! Ba'al rewards his servants!
Cunning! Brutality! Surprise! All in one swift act! Good!

This list shows all the provinces under your control, their population, public order, and wealth, and can be sorted by each of those headings. It also shows those provinces adjacent to your own, so you can make informed decisions regarding future conquests.
We row into battle men! The enemy blockade our route to the shore: send them to the sea bed!
Good work! The settlement is now under your control!
You have captured a settlement. I give thanks to Zeus that we have such a commander!

Entering into diplomacy gives your faction a means to negotiate matters of alliance, war and trade. To begin negotiations, click on the diplomacy button and double-click to select a faction from the list.
More avenues of research and training will become available as our expertise improves. Continued development and learning is vital in the race to keep in step with our enemies.
Caesar has been pulled from his horse and injured in the melee! The men will note his absence and lose heart!
The men are coming under fire! Have them break the ranks and spread out: a dense formation is an easy target for missiles.
A Samnite force lays in ambush! Draw swords!
The Samnites move out multiple armies! May the gods have mercy if they attack all at once!
Congratulations! That charge has caused the enemy to rout from the field.
Good. Your general gained a trait. A man without personality is not truly Roman!
This man has a new trait! Most excellent! He will serve you well!
Excellent! You have broken them!

As a general gains experience by leading your armies into battle, his rank and skills develop across three distinct disciplines. The “Commander” develops his influence over his troops in battle, improving his ability to inspire and rally them. The “Strategist” develops across a campaign by reducing recruitment costs, speeding-up unit replenishment, and increasing army movement extents. The “Warmonger” has influence on both the battle and campaign maps, using his growing reputation to improve unit abilities and reduce the enemy’s morale on the battlefield, whilst increasing happiness throughout friendly regions and provinces. Your general can progress evenly in each discipline or choose to specialise in a single area.

As our armies push further into the hills and mountains of Samnium we would do well to reconnoitre the terrain ahead. You should consider recruiting a spy to gather information in enemy territory, Silanus.
A strategic map is available to allow you to observe the Samnite approach, Commander. You should make use of this asset.
The tenth has been broken! A black day!
We have won! The great general Hannibal is beaten! The war is surely over!
Excellent, your general has survived the battle.
Well done! After your first battle, may count yourself a son of Mars!
Your agent has a new skill! This is good!
This is good news: your agent has a higher rank. Well done.
You show strength! An enemy region has fallen! I congratulate you! Next, the province…
Good. Your army is replenished, and can continue to serve Carthage!
Most excellent! This is a good day's work in itself!
The enemy fleet has been swept aside, Commander! The city harbour lies open!

Proconsul Gaius Fulvius Silanus! Your campaign against the Samnites has been so impressive it's little surprise that the Senate have chosen to place full civil and military power in your hands. No doubt you've heard of the staggering ransom the Samnites are demanding for the return of Consul Rutilus? We cannot consider payment: he must be regained by force.
Congratulations, you’ve captured an enemy ship.
You did that well! The charge worked, and now our enemies flee!
You have taken the province! Egypt grows ever-stronger thanks to your efforts!
Your agent of Carthage has risen in rank, because of your efforts! Excellent!
An agreement worthy of Olympian wisdom!

Spear and pike units are generally best put into tight formations to present a virtually impenetrable barrier. Often present on the frontline, and advancing as soon as the skirmishing phase has ended, they are supremely effective against cavalry. However, their lack of mobility can be exploited by skirmishers and, particularly, more agile melee infantry when in close combat. As movement is limited, the flanks and rear of spear and pike units are also particularly vulnerable, so should always be screened by more mobile troops.
Terrible news! Our commander is slain by the enemy! We have recovered the body, but word has spread through the army!

Double-click on any area of the radar map to snap directly to that area. Click on the strategic overview button to display it full screen. Lists of your faction's current forces, regions, known factions, as well as important event messages can be viewed by clicking on the buttons above it.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0049_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_dignitaries]]Dignitaries[[/url]] are experts in administration and masters of manipulation, recruited via the recruit agents button when a settlement is selected and civil technologies have been researched. They are vulnerable to [[url:/manual/single-player/0048_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_spies]]spies[[/url]] and especially effective against [[url:/manual/single-player/0050_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_champions]]champions[[/url]].
The Samnites flee! Commander, you are surely feted by the Gods! No previous leader has driven back the Samnites so quickly!
Excellent, your general has gained a character trait.
A cunning move, that flank attack! Well done!
The gods bless those who win their first battles! Well done!
The men have started work on a fortified encampment. We have prepared all that we can. There is little left to do but await the enemy arrival.
Our spotters suggest there are but five enemy units around the village. Look for their blue banners!

Tribune Silanus, news from Rome! Following the capture of Consul Rutilus and the passing of Consul Laenas at Capua, the Senate have moved to grant you emergency powers to command the defence of Campania. Your intervention at Capua saved the settlement and has earned you the highest praise on the Senate floor.
Now Vercingetorix has sent his warriors out of the fort and they are joining the fray! We fight on both sides!
Good work! The whole province now follows Roman ways.
Good work! The whole province now embraces Greek ways and wisdom!
You have the battle using beasts! Most cunning!
Excellent! Your general lives and can continue his humble service to mighty Pharaoh!
This agent of Egypt has a new trait! Such is the beneficence of the gods!
Because of your efforts, this Carthaginian general has a new household member or object!
Good! Rome needs live generals, not just dead heroes!
Excellent! A general has a new household member or object!
Light cavalry beat light troops and heavy cavalry beat light cavalry. All cavalry are vulnerable to spears. Try to match your cavalry to the right target.
We are lost! Damn you Varus, you spineless coward!
Leanas' defences are crumbling, the Samnites are crossing the river!
Let us also recruit more troops while we wait out the Samnite advance.
Congratulations, you’ve captured the enemy’s siege weapons.
Excellent! You organised the army well.
Ares himself could not have done better!
The Samnite appetite for power drives them to expand their territory in all directions. Rome is the sole power capable of checking their conquest. May the Gods help Italy if we fail.
General, look quickly! The enemy move to attack!
Good! Rome needs cunning, and that flanking attack was cunning!
Your agent has a new trait! This is good news for your cause!
A flanking attack! Excellent! A good warrior does not lean into his opponent's strength!
The gods have given this general a new trait! Congratulations!
Good. You used an ability. A good commander uses everything!
The enemies of Egypt flee like dogs! You organised that charge with skill!
Well done! You have spilled blood in battle for the first time!
Send some scouts forward to observe the Samnite advance, commander. The brow of the hill obscures our view from here.
Looting settlements and taking the natives is an excellent way of boosting slave numbers in the home regions, Proconsul.
This piece cannot move any further now. It will be available again next turn.
We're on the walls! Keep fighting!
Caesar has been hurt in the melee and carried from the field! Word has spread among the men and their confidence is shaken!

[[url:/manual/single-player/0050_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_champions]]Champions[[/url]] are heroic warriors and experts in military matters. They are recruited via the recruit agents button when a settlement is selected and military technologies have been researched. Champions are vulnerable to [[url:/manual/single-player/0049_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_dignitaries]]dignitaries[[/url]] and especially effective against [[url:/manual/single-player/0048_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_agents_spies]]spies[[/url]].
Well done, you have blockaded an enemy port!
Excellent! The enemy run because you executed that charge!
The army is replenished, so well done!
Your have taken the province for Carthage! The blessings of Ba'al fall on you like gentle rain!

When an army is first mustered, it is named, given a unique emblem and, from that point on, creates its own legacy through its actions in the field. As it wins victories on the battlefield, this legacy increases through the establishment of traditions. Some of these are unique to certain factions, and affect specific different aspects of battles and campaigns. An army’s legacy forever remains with its emblem, living on long after its original troops have succumbed to their fates. When a new army is raised, you can choose to hand down the legacy of a former army to your newest recruits.

Lightning fast, agile skirmishers, missile cavalry are best deployed on the flanks of your army, harassing an enemy line from a distance in the early stages of a battle. Typically armed with javelins or bows, they are not equipped or trained to deal with close quarters combat so should be kept out of melee engagements whenever possible. Missile cavalry are also vulnerable to attacks from other troops, particularly other cavalry.
The main body of the enemy are advancing, Silanus!
The Greek colonists have no business in Italy! Let us take their holdings and drive them into the sea!
Well done, you’ve outflanked an enemy unit.
Excellent, your agent has gained a character trait.
News! Zeus has blessed your general with a new skill! Excellent!
Good! The agent has a new skill, and can better serve the gods!
The war gods respect those who use cunning! Well done. You used an ability.
Well done, you have taken a region! This is a worthy step towards conquering the province!

Rioting has broken out in this province as the people are very unhappy. You could appease them by lowering taxes or send in troops to put them down. Whatever you decide, act quickly before the riot becomes a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]rebellion[[/url]]!

It is possible that a natural disaster will occur at some juncture, resulting in penalties such as reductions in growth and wealth or the impairment of food production, causing unhappiness amongst the populace.
The Samnites invade Lucanian territory. When the time comes it will be an honour to reinforce the Lucanians in battle. We owe them a great debt for Capua.
Commander! Ptolemy’s army has been put to the sword, and word has it that he himself has met his end at the bottom of the Nile! A great day!
You gain experience from your victories, Silanus! Be sure to make use of your newfound wisdom!
Good! Your agent has gained a trait. Your work has been useful!
Congratulations! The port is blockaded as you ordered!
You have captured a region! Well done! Soon, perhaps, the whole province will belong to Carthage!
Silanus, some Lucanian ships have raised the banner of Rome and stand ready to assist in the assault on Buxentum. Enlist their support!
Sir! Caesar himself has been injured in the fighting, and can no longer rally the men! They lose heart!
Most excellent! The enemy ship sinks! The screams of drowning foes are pleasant, yes?
This is good. The port is blockaded and you show firmness and strength.
It is good that you took a ship! Your service to Egypt is truly worthy.
Good work! Your troops benefit from strong leadership!
Most excellent! You are a flame in the desert to our enemies!

Powerful shock troops, war elephants are one of the most efficient ways of disrupting enemy lines. Best used against a disordered foe or to help screen the flanks of your army, they should be kept in reserve and out of the enemy’s reach until called upon. Due to their size, these beasts are best matched against heavy infantry: enemy skirmishers and light cavalry can defeat them with their fast, nimble attacks. Elephants can run amok if sufficiently hurt or frightened by the enemy. To stop them trampling your own troops you can use the Kill Elephant ability.
This army has done all it can this season. It must rest for now.
The family & politics tab depicts the various parties within your ruling faction, enables you to assign government offices and engage in politics with them.
By all the gods! Well done! Using beasts to win - excellent!
A new trait for this agent is welcome news! Most excellent!
That is good. You have used an ability. Wisdom is as good as a sword.

A province consists of up to four regions, each one containing a settlement. One of these is always the provincial capital, a major, walled settlement, whilst the remainder are minor settlements without defensive walls. Building construction improves both the strategic and economic potential of a settlement and enables it to grow. Over time, provincial growth enables you to develop settlements, either by upgrading existing buildings or by constructing additional ones. Depending on the resources available, different types of buildings can be developed. Coastal settlements can also contain port buildings. When a faction owns an entire province, provincial edicts may be issued. Lasting for a single turn, they nevertheless have powerful effects, such as increased tax income or improved public order. The number of edicts that can be issued per turn depends on your faction’s imperium.
We are clear of the woods! The legions are preserved!
This is no time for celebration, however. The situation remains grim. Survey the map for yourself.
We are beaten! Let us hope that the Gauls show mercy!
Look! Pompey flees the battlefield! His men will surely follow.

You are at war with the Etruscan League. March north and capture their territories: this will allow you to consolidate Italia and ensure the safety of Roma. You must wage war if you hope to extend your dominion. Syracuse and Carthage own territory in Magna Graecia, so conflict with them is inevitable if you wish to expand across the Mediterranean. Otherwise, they may prove useful allies against Etruria or the Gaulish tribes to the north. Come what may, Rome will triumph!
I give thanks to Jupiter! You have taken a province! Well done!
Well done. Your agent has a new skill.
Ba'al rewards his followers! Well done! This general has a new household member or object.

Technology reflects the advancement of your faction through new ideas and techniques, allowing you to construct advanced buildings, new unit types or greatly improved equipment. A faction can develop technology along three paths of specialisation, each consisting of three interlocking modules. While each technology has its own inherent benefits, researching all technologies within a module has an overall effect that is greater than the sum of its parts.

Take time to explore the battle user interface. Press buttons and click on graphics for details of their function. Further information is available through tooltips when mousing over an item or from the encyclopaedia.
Our allies report that the Samnites march with many skirmishers within their ranks. We must consider the balance of our own forces.
The enemy attack has been repelled, but their main army is entrenched at the top of the hill. Let us advance!
Let them approach. That muddy ground will sap their strength!
Malventum's famed suburbia makes for an excellent environment in which to gather intelligence, Silanus. You should consider recruiting a spy here to give us reconnaissance on Samnite movements.
Fine work, my soldiers, the field is ours! Tonight we divide the spoils.

Your faction is now bankrupt! There is no money left in your [[url:/manual/single-player/0046_enc_page_campaign_play_province_trade_finance#enc_text_manual_hud_finances]]treasury[[/url]], but there are several things you can do to reverse the situation: raise taxes if possible, establish further trade agreements and trade routes, or disband unused units.
We're under missile fire! Double-time!

A non-aggression pact is a temporary agreement between two factions not to attack each other for a period of time. It can be broken at any time by either party, but there is a diplomatic relations penalty for doing so. Breaking a pact within ten turns is seen as treachery and will therefore affect the ability to broker of future agreements.
Well done, you’ve successfully used beasts to defeat the enemy!
Your general has gained a trait! Excellent! What kind of man has no personality?
You captured an enemy ship! Be proud!
Your general is alive. You have done well in this matter.
Excellent! With proper fighting ships we can launch a invasion from the sea where we please.

Details of [[url:/manual/single-player/0013_enc_page_campaign_play_objectives]]objectives[[/url]], missions, and victory conditions are stored here. Each faction has a set of predetermined [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]territorial[[/url]] conquests that it must complete in order to attain victory. Click on a mission to check the time remaining for completion or read its details again.
You have captured a province! I give thanks to Zeus that you fight for our people!
An excellent thing, a captured enemy ship. You are a worthy admiral!
Units will gain experience as they fight, commander, but will also take casualties. Be sure to monitor the health of your army and deploy or rest the men as necessary.

The delay phase allows you to use the weather to your advantage by picking the optimum conditions for your units to fight in. For instance, if the enemy have a lot of missile weapons fighting in the rain will reduce their effectiveness.
When viewing user interface panels you will notice a question mark button. This is the help button, click on it for an in-depth explanation of the panel's functionality.

Infantry make a good fixing force to hold the enemy in place while cavalry outflank and kill, but any combination of cavalry, infantry and missile troops can be made to work as fixing and killing forces.
Long-standing trade partners develop a healthy respect for each other, reflected by increased income from trade routes over the life of the agreement.

The [[url:/manual/single-player/0092d_enc_page_battle_play_interface_speed]]game speed[[/url]] controls are used to adjust the speed of the battle. You can pause the game or put it into slow motion, clicking on the central button again to return it to normal.

This tab shows all the units or ships available for [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruitment[[/url]] in the selected [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]]. Right-click on the unit or ship card to see its description. Left-click on it to add it to the queue, and again to remove it. Recruitment cost is displayed underneath, recruitment time is shown in the top left-hand corner of the card.
Light infantry carry wooden stakes to deter the attentions of enemy cavalry. Deploy them at any time using the dedicated button on the battle control panel.
You have successfully raided the enemy's trade along this route. Their income now fills your coffers!

The review panel contains the unit or ship cards representing your force. Clicking on a card selects a unit or ship, double-clicking on it zooms the camera directly to it. Pausing the game then right-clicking on a card opens an information panel.
You have selected a character belonging to another faction that you cannot control. Please select one of your own to learn more about their abilities.
Attacking infantry from behind is the single best way to kill them with cavalry, but always keep an eye out for enemy troops supporting them!
Don't start your attack by engaging the enemy's elite troops. In a perfect battle you would rout their army without fighting their best units at all.

Wedge formation increases the violence of a cavalry charge. Intended to drive a wedge through the enemy unit and cause maximum casualties, this formation is also useful for charging through narrow gaps. Select wedge formation using the button on the battle control panel.

This panel gives information about a building's effects, along with a detailed description of its function. Most buildings allow you to [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]construct[[/url]] other, more advanced ones - so it's worth reading all the information here and checking the [[url:/home]]encyclopaedia[[/url]] too.

Attrition is the loss of men due to desertion, disease, etc. An army will generally suffer [[url:/manual/single-player/0026_enc_page_campaign_play_military_replenish]]attrition[[/url]] when in desert or extremely cold conditions unless it is native to that part of the world. Ship crews and armies transported by sea may also suffer attrition when in deep waters.
Try to keep some forces in reserve behind the front line. They can fill any gaps that develop and turn to deal with threats to either flank.
One of your land trade routes is under attack from an enemy army. Without intervention they will continue to take your income for themselves!
If your army has superiority in terms of firepower you may be able to force a defender off the hill with missiles alone. Use all your ammunition before assaulting the hill.

Grab the enemy by the throat and then hit them in the vitals! It is the most basic strategy and is always valid. Have one part of your army hold the enemy in place while the rest manoeuvre to kill them.

The best admirals adapt their tactics to the given situation. Take advantage of fog or heavy smoke to hide small or heavily damaged ships. This makes the enemy's job more difficult, a factor which can often prove crucial during the course of a battle.

Your port has been blockaded by an enemy fleet. This does not affect your ability to build new ships or repair existing combat-damaged ships, but all trade income through it will be suspended for the life of the blockade. Attack the enemy fleet to break out and restore trade.

The [[url:/manual/single-player/0092b_enc_page_battle_play_interface_compass]]manoeuvre[[/url]] compass is used for fine-tuning orders. It can be used to direct a unit, ship or group straight ahead, or turn left or right.

When using light infantry or skirmishers to force light troops to retreat behind their lines, be careful not to chase them too far. Do not risk getting dragged into a fight with their frontline units.
Hiding stronger units to the rear may entice the enemy into a rash attack. They can then be brought up quickly to attack the weakest point.

Winning a battle isn't just about greater numbers, the balance of units and the general's ability are important factors also. Look at the strength ratio and any reinforcement information before committing yourself, but beware, if you are attacked it may not be possible to avoid combat! The buttons on this panel represent your battle options. Mouse over each one to see what it does.

Terrain and settlements that are known to your faction but to which you have no line of sight are covered by the fog of war. Use your agents and forces to reveal the machinations of your rivals before they act against you!

[[url:/manual/single-player/0082_enc_page_battle_play_phase_conflict_groups]]Grouped[[/url]] units or ships can be set to one of several fixed group [[url:/manual/single-player/0081_enc_page_battle_play_phase_conflict_army_formations]]formations[[/url]]. Select a formation from the options presented to you. Move your mouse over each one to see what it does.
The boarding button orders your ship to close with the target vessel and sends an armed group aboard to capture it. This action can be cancelled at any time by issuing another order.

Pressing the space bar on your keyboard after orders have been issued displays the positions your units will move to as a shadow on the battlefield. Use this as a reference when deploying your forces.
Information about any selected character, army, fleet, port or settlement is displayed here, including their constituent units or ships.

This panel gives information about how a [[url:/manual/single-player/0039_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_technology]]technology's[[/url]] effects are applied, along with a detailed description of its function. Some technologies are essential for [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]constructing[[/url]] certain buildings, so it's worth reading all the information here and checking the [[url:/home]]encyclopaedia[[/url]] too.

Generals can use their rally ability to raise the morale of any unit and try to stop routing troops running from the field - except those in a shattered state, who will always ignore the call to rally. Once activated, the cursor can be placed anywhere within the radius of the selected general's influence.
One of your sea trade routes is under attack from an enemy fleet! If you do not intervene they will continue to take your income for themselves!
The naturally occurring resources or cultural buildings that are this region's speciality are yet to be exploited to their full potential.

Useful natural resources are present in many regions. Their exploitation increases the income available through trade, and in some cases improves the quality of the weapons and armour that can be produced. Build or improve farms, mines and region speciality buildings to get the most from the available resources.

You have not researched any of the new [[url:/manual/single-player/0039_enc_page_campaign_play_faction_technology]]technologies[[/url]] for some time, your rivals may be moving far ahead of you. Concepts that will give your faction the advantage can be developed on the technology panel.
Military access is a symbol of trust between two factions, allowing troops to move about and replenish in one another's territory without diplomatic penalties.

Units are [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruited[[/url]], or mustered, directly by a general in the field. Select the recruitment tab, then left-click on a unit to add it to the queue. Left-click again to remove it. When ready, units automatically appear in the army of the general who mustered them. It is not possible to move a [[url:/manual/single-player/0018_enc_page_campaign_play_military_stances#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_stances_muster]]mustering[[/url]] army without first cancelling the recruitment process.
A fight between two spear-equipped infantry units usually comes down to troop quality and numbers. Make sure you have local superiority - or send in some supporting troops.
When defending a river crossing it may be best to stand back in order to stay out of range of enemy missile troops. When their main force starts to cross, rush a couple of units up to stop them.
The movement speed button is used to instantly increase or decrease the speed of units or ships. This is useful for going somewhere in a hurry, but using it too much causes fatigue.
If the enemy is forming for an attack, it's often a good idea to let them come forward and tire themselves through marching.

Take the initiative in battle by making manoeuvres the enemy must respond to. Even if you don't follow it through, they'll be so busy countering your moves they'll have no time to make any of their own.
There is an armed rebellion occurring in a neighbouring region! This wave of insurrection may reach your territory, guard against it by increasing garrison sizes or reducing taxes.
Forces that are not large enough to be effective could be destroyed if attacked, so it is prudent to merge any fragments together. Select one and right-click on another to merge with it.

This panel is used to manually merge armies or fleets in order to assemble the strongest possible force. Click on the unit or ship you wish to move, then click on the tick button to move it from one force to another. It is possible to select several units or ships at a time.
Cavalry troops make an excellent flanking force. They can move fast around the edge of the enemy formation and strike the sides or rear, but a clever opponent will be ready for this.
When outnumbered, make sure you keep open the option of withdrawal. This will help you to reduce casualties if the battle is being lost.

This list shows all factions currently known to you, whether you can trade or are trading with them, their diplomatic status and current attitude towards you. It can be sorted by each of those headings.

Units with banners that have turned white are routing - they have broken and are running away, and won't follow any more of your orders. If positioned close by, your general may be able to rally these troops with his special ability. If successful you'll regain control of them.

Generals deploy their forces according to rank. A higher ranking general deploys after lower ranking ones, giving him the ability to view the deployment of a lower ranking opponent before committing his own troops.
Mines facilitate the harvesting of underground resources such as gold and iron for trade and weapon-making purposes.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order#enc_text_manual_public_order_rebellions]]Rebellions[[/url]] grow in strength over time the more they are left unchecked. You must always act quickly in these instances lest the rebels may take over the [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]].

In order to gain control of a garrisoned and fortified settlement it is often necessary to lay siege. During a siege your troops surround the settlement and will either attempt to starve the defenders into capitulation or launch a direct assault.
Wherever possible fight downhill. Whoever is higher has a great advantage.
Pressing this button cancels orders and makes selected units or ships stop where they are. This is a quicker alternative to giving them a different order.

Every army, fleet or agent can reveal information about rival armies, fleets and settlements in their immediate proximity or within their line of sight. The level of detail available depends on the type of character who is spying, so, for instance, spies are able to reveal more than champions.
Killing their general early on will deliver a heavy blow to the enemy army's morale.

Group selected units or ships together here. [[url:/manual/single-player/0082_enc_page_battle_play_phase_conflict_groups]]Groups[[/url]] are useful for giving identical orders via a single command. You can reselect the group by clicking on its numbered tab, or by pressing the corresponding number key. Press this button again to dissolve the group.

This panel shows you information about an allied, neutral or enemy [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]character[[/url]]. His name, position on the map, character [[url:/manual/single-player/0052_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_traits]]traits[[/url]] and [[url:/manual/single-player/0051_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_skills]]skills[[/url]] relating to military abilities are all listed, along with details of any [[url:/manual/single-player/0053_enc_page_campaign_play_characters_ancillaries]]household[[/url]] members or objects.

Right-click to [[url:/manual/single-player/0019_enc_page_campaign_play_military_movement]]move[[/ur]] your army or fleet to any part of the highlighted area. You can [[url:/manual/single-player/0016_enc_page_campaign_play_military_attack]]attack[[/url]] by right-clicking on a rival faction's army or [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]settlement[[/url]]. Board a fleet by right-clicking on the sea, your army will automatically join a troop transport. Merge with a friendly army or fleet by moving onto the same spot.

Some units are masters of concealment and can make themselves almost invisible in any terrain. Try putting these troops off to the side of your main force, where the enemy may not notice them. A surprise flank attack can then be launched once the battle has begun.
Hills are good defensive positions, as being higher up a slope gives a large advantage in combat. Aim to fight the enemy on the steepest slope, not on the flatter top of the hill.

Money can be offered to or demanded as reparations for war, tribute to avoid attack, or simply as an act of goodwill. If it is not part of a diplomatic deal you are brokering such payments are considered to be state gifts.
There are not enough funds in your treasury to build anything this turn. Increase taxation and trade, or disband redundant armed forces to raise your short-term income.
The balance of power bar tracks the relative strength of your force against that of your enemy.
There is barely enough money in your treasury to cover costs. You can ensure your provinces are taxed effectively by ensuring their settlements are upgraded to the highest available levels.

The road system within a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]region[[/url]] will improve as prosperity increases. Better quality roads increase the movement range of the [[url:/manual/single-player/0016_enc_page_campaign_play_military_attack]]armies[[/url]] and agents who use them, as well as the line of sight from both the road and the nearest settlement. They also improve the chances of detecting enemy [[url:/manual/single-player/0047_enc_page_campaign_play_characters]]agents[[/url]].
The treasury indicates the amount of money currently in your faction's coffers and is displayed next to your projected income for the next turn and the current date.

Flashing banners mean your line is wavering and the troops close to breaking and routing. Use your general's inspiration ability to keep them in the fight a little longer. Some elite infantry types can also inspire courage in nearby comrades.
At any time during a conflict, this option can be used to request that a faction joins a war that you are fighting, meaning you can look for new allies to help if the conflict is not going your way.
Deploying on a hill is always a good idea. Being uphill gives your troops a melee advantage, and climbing it will tire the enemy. Shooting downhill helps too.
Always try to present a solid wall of troops to the enemy. Large gaps between units will let them flood through and behind your units, which would be disastrous.
Rather than racing the enemy to get control of high ground, try to approach it out of sight so they see no reason to hurry, while distracting them with bait they cannot resist.

Following capture of a [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]settlement[[/url]], local unrest may require a garrison remains while any damaged buildings are [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction#enc_text_manual_actions_campaign_construction_repair]]repaired[[/url]] and public order is stabilised.
There is often an advantage in ordering your infantry to counter-charge an attacking formation. The trick is to leave it until the last moment, so your own lines are not broken.

This panel shows statistical information about the selected [[url:/manual/single-player/0044_enc_page_campaign_play_province_regions]]province[[/url]]. The right-hand section shows the elements affecting, and status of, [[url:/manual/single-player/0044a_enc_page_campaign_play_province_public_order]]public order[[/url]] and the left-hand section shows the factors contributing to the wealth of the local and [[url:/manual/single-player/0036_enc_page_campaign_play_faction]]faction[[/url]] economy.
A very large army or fleet spread over two or more unit stacks may not be able to fight as a single force. A faction can field a maximum of forty units at one time across two armies.

Your general has the ability to raise the morale of nearby troops from his own army, although not those of any allies present. If placed near a unit that is wavering his presence may give his men the resolve they need to stay in the fight.

Your faction is bankrupt due to high army upkeep costs. All [[url:/manual/single-player/0017_enc_page_campaign_play_military_recruit]]recruitment[[/url]] and [[url:/manual/single-player/0045_enc_page_campaign_play_province_construction]]construction[[/url]] has been halted until funds are available. You could reduce upkeep costs by disbanding unused units.
To outflank the enemy, go around the ends of their line and attack their sides and rear. You will also need to engage their centre to hold them in place and stop them turning to face you.
This option is used to ask a faction to abandon their alliance with another, preventing dangerous coalitions from emerging against you.
When forced to fight in mountain passes stay close to the valley walls. You may be able to take advantage of the slopes, or at least use them to protect one flank.

[[url:/manual/single-player/0092f_enc_page_battle_play_interface_fire]]Fire-at-will[[/url]] for missiles can be toggled on or off. Keeping it toggled off will help preserve ammunition, but then your units or ships will only fire when specifically ordered.

The enemy will try to either sneak past your defences or rush them by force of arms. Use missile troops to kill approaching enemies and melee troops to kill those that get to the plaza. They will try to wipe out all defenders, and if your men rout en masse then the battle is over.

A straight line of units is not always the best formation. A kink, vee or step will create a point in the line where two of your units can engage one of theirs. Exploit this, but remember it works both ways.

When in [[url:/manual/single-player/0092l_enc_page_battle_play_interface_skirmish]]skirmish[[/url]] mode, troops avoid getting into [[url:/manual/single-player/0092j_enc_page_battle_play_interface_melee]]melee[[/url]] by keeping their distance from the enemy and attacking with arrows, javelins or sling shot. When a unit of missile troops is selected the skirmish mode button will appear. It can be toggled on or off.
